text: Lighted HOMES dot the landscape. Clinging like stragglers to the steep canyon. Wreathed in fog. Secure. Sleepy. Above, random cars shuush by up on Mulholland.

Nestled in the canyon. The back door opens, emits a brief shaft of light, as a BOY (14) in pajamas lets the dog out He shuts the door. And the CAMERA DRIFTS alongside the house. He's visible through windows, heading down the hal switching off lights as he goes.

head_text.subj: WE PUSH IN THROUGH A WINDOW

text: Following behind the boy. Down a darkened hallway as he stops at one particular door... He turns the knob, ever so gently. Listens... Then -- CLICK--! The boy switches on a PEN FLASHLIGHT. Enters the room. Creeping in carefully, inching his way towards A BED. He leans down. Peers underneath. From above, SNORING. Mom, Pop. He shines the light: THERE, under the bed, surrounded by dust bunnies--
The boy grasps one from the top. Gingerly, slides it off. Stands again. Penlight, off. Heads back out

The boy (let's call him Bobby) moves quickly now. Starts back down the hallway, examining the magazine. It's called BUSTER. And it's a clear product of its decad The cover prominently features a porn star with a notewor rack... Bold lettering proclaims her to be: SUPERSTAR MIS MOUNTAINS. Bobby smiles. We follow him into the KITCHEN. He raids the fridge. Find half a HAM SANDWICH, drops it on a plate. Eyes riveted on CENTERFOLD: MISTY in full glory-- He turns, heads toward his room... A man with a purpose. we want to know this purpose? He stops. Damn. Forgot something. Jogs back, with us in Crosses to the fridge. Opens it. Grabs a bottle of milk. Of course, forgot the milk. Where's our thinking? He stands, the kitchen window at his back, and pours hims a glass... And that's when we see something he doesn't--

A CAR. Way in the distance. A POWDER-BLUE TRANS AM. It appears out of nowhere. Punching through the guardrail on Mulholland with a fog-muffled CRUMP-! It's almost comical. Half-obscured by Bobby's head, the c crosses our POV. Showering earth. Then it's GONE. Blink and you missed it. Window, boring a Holy shit. BOBBY, oblivious. Leaves the kitchen, actually yanks our POV away. Walks, juggling the sandwich and magazine, into the living room. Raises the glass of milk, takes a sip --
Just DISINTEGRATES. The whole damn thing. Part of the CEILING going with it, as

BLASTS into the house, moving impossibly fast. Showering DEBRIS. Trailing trees, brush... It hurtles across the room. DETONATES obstacles. BLOWS th splinters. Sweeps the place clean, doing 50, half on its Then, just as promptly, DEPARTS. Crash--! Sails OUT THE OPPOSITE WALL. Into the night. Just like that. CAMERA PANS TO FOLLOW -- Peering out the gaping HOLE, out and down -- Unbelievable. There it is, STILL GOING. Plunging down a HILLSIDE. Tumbling. Chewing up huge GOUTS of dirt. WHAM--! It slams to a STOP. A hundred yards down the hill Battered. Smoking... Stillness, then. Echoes, fading... BOBBY, knocked off his feet by the impact, stands shakily Stares out what used to be the back wall of his house...

BOBBY staggers downhill in his PJs. Past uprooted trees, gouged earth. Trailing in the car's WAKE -- The sound of DOGS BARKING fills the canyon now. Faintly w hear Bobby's PARENTS up above. Calling his name. Bobby stumbles. Falls. Rolls to his feet... THERE, BELOW. The car sits steaming. Roof pancaked. He forces his feet to move. Approaches the wreck as you'd approach a sleeping dragon. Cranes his neck for a look... The car is empty. And then A COUGH. BEHIND him, he spins- Stops dead. Transfixed.

Lies twisted against a rock. Completely nude. Famous curv bruised, discolored (this is to be handled tastefully.) Bobby can't help staring. He tries to make sense of what seeing: That's Misty Mountains. That's her in the flesh. Her breath comes in hitches, gulps. Her eyes are swimming. Unfocused. Finally notices BOBBY. Fixes him with a pain-wracked star

How... do you like my car... Big Boy. SIRENS, approaching. She convulses. Spasms once, twice. BLOOD jets from her mo She dies staring at him. The strangest moment of this kid's young life. The two of them in tableau. SIRENS, closer now. Wind, gus We hold... And then Bobby does something odd. He grips hi pajama top. Yanks it over his head. Shivers, it's cold. Steps up next to the corpse... Delicately lays the fabric across her. Covers her up. Withdraws. Stands trembling in the cold. Waiting on the sirens... CUT TO BLACK. ROLL CREDITS.  Pause, then-- HEALY (v.o) It's a different world these days. More cynical. Less innocent. You see it all around... You see it in the kids--
A roomful of sullen, vacant-eyed kids (mean age of, say 1 watching an ancient EDUCATIONAL FILM. Subject: GRAMMAR. ONSCREEN - A young boy holds up a white BEACH TOWEL:
Bart has a PLAIN towel. The word "adjective!" appears on screen, DING..! And then Bart is replaced by a little girl clutching a YELLOW TOWE
Sarah has a BRIGHT towel. DING..! Another kid, another towel. This one multi-colore

Jonathan has a GAY towel. The classroom erupts in LAUGHTER... Apparently this is th funniest thing ever. One kid actually falls out of his se CAMERA settles on one YOUNG GIRL in particular, laughing with her classmates. Dark hair. Beautiful. HEALY (v.o.) They know too much. Precocious is a good word... only that doesn't get it. It's like precocious, only shittier...

School's out. Kids exit the building. Moving in cliques. Stoners. Skaters. More Stoners. It's the 70's, after all. CAMERA FINDS our YOUNG BEAUTY as she starts home. After a moment, a fire-engine red CORVETTE pulls alongside her. Turns out she knows the guy in the car -- the MUCH OLDER in the car... They strike up a conversation as

SOMEONE watches from a store window across the street.  He's got a kind face, this man. Late-thirties maybe. For the record? Meet JACKSON HEALY. HEALY (v.o.) Take this one. Thirteen and already she's got herself a winner. Sure, he's three times her age... But he's got money for pot. And he drives a nice car.
The RED CORVETTE is parked in the driveway of one of thos modern boxes on stilts that populate the hills.
To an open WINDOW. We HEAR people having sex inside: OLDER MAN (0.s.) Yeah! Who's the man, baby?! Who?! YOUNG BEAUTY (o.s.) -.. You are. You're the man. Oh, yes. You're the man! You! You!

Just below the window. Hidden in SHADOW. Bored, eating peanuts. Pops them one at a time... Munches. Listening: YOUNG BEAUTY (o.s.) You're the man! You're my Foxy-fox! Healy frowns: Foxy-fox..? YOUNG BEAUTY (o.s.) Foxy-fox! Foxy-fox! Healy shrugs. Picks through his handful of nuts... Whispers to himself:
Yeah, but is he the man...?
Oh, yes baby! Yes! You're the man, baby! Ah, that's better... Healy smiles as he finds a cashew. HEALY (v.o.) Love. Grand, isn't it? (beat) I was in love once. June Miller.
HEALY sits across a table from a knockout BLONDE. They st into each other's eyes. A beat. Healy starts to say somet The blonde cuts him off:

Jack... I slept with your father. The guy at the next table does a SPIT TAKE. BACK TO SCENE - Healy dusts peanut debris from his hands. HEALY (v.o.) Marriage is buying a house for someone you hate... Remember that.

The YOUNG BEAUTY exits. Alone. Her BICYCLE, stashed by th front door. Banana seat. Tassels on the handlebars. She g on, rides off. HEALY steps from the shadows. Stares after HEALY (v.o.) Yep, these days the world is a vulgar, unromantic place... HEALY cracks his neck. Grimaces. Slips on a pair of BRASS KNUCKLES. Starts towards the front of the house-- HEALY (v.o.) So I adjust. Healy knocks on the FRONT DOOR. The OLDER GUY answers it.
Are you the man?

What..? Healy SLUGS him. WHAM--! SHATTERS the man's JAW-- And right then we FREEZE FRAME. On the moment of impact. The poor guy's face CONTORTED IMPOSSIBLY. Sickeningly. HEALY (v.o) I don't have a job title. I'm not in the yellow pages... But if you've got trouble with someone --

Setting up for the night's business. Healy sits in a boot the back of the club. An older man sits across from him.  HEALY (v.o.) -- Someone's threatening you, someone's messing around with your underage daughter. Whatever -- The older man gives Healy an ENVELOPE. Shakes his hand. L HEALY (v.o.) -- You might ask around for me: Jackson Healy's the name... When business is good, I'm easy to find. When it isn't--?

Crammed to overflowing with weary travelers. The color ORANGE at the apparent height of its popularity. Healy sits by himself in the first row. A slim metal BRIEFCASE rests on the seat by his side. HEALY (v.o.) , -- Means I'm traveling... The 1° and 14° of every month. Healy reaches into the front pocket of his jacket, takes a pack of PARLIAMENTS. Lights up, one handed. Never taking his other hand off the briefcase. HEALY (v.o.) LA to New York. Drop off and pick up. No questions asked. Not something I'm proud of... But it's work. A stewardess approaches Healy--

Sir..? I'm sorry, but if you'd like to smoke you'll have to move to the smoking section of the plane. Healy follows her finger. On the floor, a yellow LINE. Be that, a bunch of people smoking. Healy gets up -- Moves FIVE WHOLE FEET. Sits. Ah. Now it's cool to smoke. Joins his fellow smokers, puffing away. Smoke BILLOWS throughout the plane... A BABY coughs.

The city of Los Angeles laid out as far as the eye can se Which isn't that far, really. SMOG obscures most of the v TWO CARS are parked up here. Healy's Chevelle, and a Ford  Healy leans against the Ford. HEALY (v.o.) Sometimes I feel okay about things. Not often. Scotty, my AA sponsor, keeps trying to get me to quit this kind of work. Inside the Ford is a WOMAN. Dirty blonde hair. Young. Healy a slip of PINK, COW-SHAPED NOTEPAPER:

I think there's two of ‘em... I just got the name and description for one. They've been talking to all my friends, asking where I live. I'm scared. Healy studies the slip of paper. Pockets it. The woman hands him an envelope.
You'll take care of ‘em?
Consider it done. The girl offers Healy a fragile smile.
Thank you... I feel better already. You... You make me feel safe.
(smiles) That's my job. Healy starts to leave, counting the money in the envelope Then stops. Turns back. Leans in the window:
Um, you're short.
I'm... What?
You're twenty bucks short.
Oh. I'm sorry... Here, ummm... She fishes through her purse for some cash. Finds two ten
Sorry, here...

The FORD drives off. Taillights, receding. Healy watches HEALY (v.o.) Truth is, I've been thinking about what Scotty said... I could try for an investigators' license. Become a detective, you know..? Those guys help people. (beat) Maybe then I'd feel good in the morning. CUT TO BLACK. Pause. Then--

A HAND dangles limply from the edge of a PORCELAIN TUB. WIDEN to reveal a tousled-looking MAN, 40-ish. FULLY DRESSED, immersed in water up to his neck. Dead asleep... Meet HOLLAND MARCH. Somewhere in the house a PHONE starts to RING. Slowly, March's EYES open. He sits up, sloshing water. Winces. Puts a hand to his throbbing temple. Stops, frown There's something WRITTEN on the palm of his hand. With a permanent marker, in an unmistakably feminine scri

March just stares at it: How did that get there..? The ph still RINGING. March ignores it. An answering machine pic ANSWERING MACHINE (0.s.) You have reached March Investigations. This machine records messages. Wait for the tone, and speak clearly. A BEEP, followed by: YOUNG GIRL'S VOICE (HOLLY) (o.s.) This is your daughter speaking. Thursday, as you may remember, is my birthday. Please give accordingly -- March waves a hand at no one in particular.
Yeah, yeah... YOUNG GIRL'S VOICE (HOLLY) (o.s.) Also, I hope you didn't forget that you're supposed to be working today --  10 March blinks. A beat, then:
Oh, shi-- He's already leaping out of the tub. Over this we HEAR: MARCH (v.o.) What with the world coming to an end, you'd think people would, you know, band together or something...

March in a beat-up CONVERTIBLE. Stuck in a GAS LINE. Cars HONKING as March inches towards the ARCO STATION. MARCH (v.o.) Nossir. People are still mean and petty and unforgiving... which is good, ‘cuz otherwise I'd be out of a job. Up at the pumps, a FIGHT breaks out. March ignores it... Peruses the day's newspaper. A featured headline:

He takes out a PORTABLE ELECTRIC RAZOR the size of a BRIC Starts shaving. The glamorous life of a detective. MARCH (v.o.) They implemented a no-fault divorce here couple of years back. That screwed things up... Lotta private cops folded. (beat) Not me. I got this guy, runs security at a local retirement park, he kicks a few cases my way -- slam dunks, most of ‘em.
March, in the living room, talking to an OLD LADY. He writes in a notebook as she relates her problem:
It's my husband. Fred is his name. He's gone missing.
(professional concern) Missing..? I see.  11

I'm terribly worried... Fred's just never been gone for this long. March nods, writes... Then spots something out of the cor of his eye: There's an URN over the fireplace. March squints at the PLAQUE affixed to it: FRED MILLER -- A devoted and loving husband. March frowns.
Um, Mrs. Miller... Your husband Fred..? Exactly how long has he been missing?
Oh, let's see... (furrows her brow) Probably since the funeral. March nods.
I see... I see... (puts away notebook) Well, I can start today if you like.

March slouches in his car. Watches through the window of Hollywood SEX SHOP. A couple debates which dildo to buy. man holds up several; the woman shakes her head. MARCH (v.o.) Lean pickings, but I hang in... Maybe I'm a fighter. Maybe someday people will notice. Maybe the flying pigs will tell them. MARCH snaps pictures of the couple. The woman shakes her head, still obstinate --

(sighs) Honey, you're not gonna find one with a breadmaker in it, just buy the fucking thing. He snaps another photo.  12 MARCH (v.o.) In the meantime, I take whatever's out there. It's bottom feeding, sure. But at least you're getting fed.
March is talking to the guy behind the counter:

... She's blonde, about yea high..? Might be from the neighborhood. Name's Amelia. The worker shakes his head. March turns, and we follow him OUT OF THE SHOP. He stands the sidewalk out here, stares down the street at a long l other establishments-- MARCH (v.o.) It ain't rocket science. It's grunt work.

Literally going store to store. Asking questions at the Quick-e-Mart. At a fast food join Talking to a VALET. Talking to a NUDE DANCER, Bent-double peeking through her knees... She shakes her head, no. MARCH (v.o) You ask questions. Pound the pavement. Chances are something's gonna pop--
MARCH'S CONVERTIBLE pulls to the curb. He gets out, notic his hand: YOU WILL NEVER BE HAPPY. Faded, but still there Scowls at it. Looks down the row of seamy BARS --
MARCH talking to the bartender. Looking worn out.
I think I remember her. Amelia, right? She was in three, four nights ago. Drank bourbon martinis. March perks up instantly:
That's disgusting. Pay with a credit card, by any chance?  13
As in, am I gonna pull the receipts for you? Fat fucking chance. March offers up a folded $10 bill.
That's very pretty.
I made it myself.
Yeah? I made this. He produces a carved wooden BAT from under the bar. CUT T

Dark. Shadowy. Across the alley, we see the same bartende LOCKING UP. He pockets the keys. Heads off... MARCH (v.o.) Look, I'm not saying it's easy. I'm not saying you don't gotta think on your feet. Bend a few rules, maybe. Pan to REVEAL MARCH, behind a dumpster. Dark sweater, bla cloth cap. He takes a RAG, proceeds to wrap his KNUCKLES.
March sidles up, whistling. Glances both ways. MARCH (v.o) But it's worth it. As long as you get the results-- He braces himself. PUNCHES THROUGH the glass pane.
Ow! Shit! He pulls his hand back out. His wrist is BLEEDING. Fuck. He puts pressure on it. Red SEEPS through his fingers.
Ow, OW, Ow. Damn, that's a lot of blood. He takes the RAG from his knuckles, tries to cover the wound... The rag turns red instantly. Starts dripping.  14

Woah. Ow. Woah. Lots of blood. Lots of blood. Okay. Okay. March takes a few steps back, stumbles. Suddenly dizzy no Goddamn, that's a lot of blood. He shifts his grip -- and a literal STREAM OF BLOOD spews preposterously. Straight up into the air. He teeters ina tight little circle. Blood squirting everywhere.
Okay. Ow. Wait, wait. Okay. Okay. His eyes start to flutter now as we SLAM-CUT TO:
Blasting through traffic, siren WAILING. March's face, CHALK-WHITE. Head lolling. A MEDIC hunches over him--
I need two units of whole blood! Shit! BP dropping! Christ, we're LOSING HIM--! The ambulance careens across lanes. CUT TO:
The night quiet. Serene. A HOSPITAL NUN wheels a bandaged March outside, to a waiting TAXI. Helps him stand.
Tell me, are you willing to find God?
(doped up) No can do... I'm already looking for Amelia. He staggers to the cab, climbs in. MARCH (v.o.) Bottom line, I get by. I make some money. I live my life. I'm happy...

A placid, narcotized MARCH in back. MARCH (v.o.) Except, you know, for all the stuff I'm not happy about... But it's best not to think about that.  15 The taillights recede into the gleaming distance.
A thick crust of smog hangs in the air. The sun still bla
The Air Quality Management District today issued a stage two smog alert for most of the Los Angeles basin...

It's a small place. Situated just above "The Comedy Store on Sunset. Clean. Spartan. It looks like a monk lives her Healy lies in bed, atop rumpled sheets. Stares at the cei The newscast continues on the TV nearby:

The AQMD cautions residents not to engage in any unnecessary exercise until after 6 pm tonight... Healy checks the time: 4:21 PM. Sighs. Sits up. NEWSCASTER (v.o.) Infamous adult film star Misty Mountains was pronounced dead early yesterday morning, after driving her car off a Canyon road. Drugs may have played a-- Healy shuts the TV off. TIME CUT: HEALY BUTTONING HIS DRESS SHIRT. He stops to sprinkle fish-food into a saltwater aquarium. On his desk, a daily "tear-off" CALENDAR. Your word for t day! He tears off yesterday's page. Reveals today's word: Equanimity \e-qua-nim-i-ty\, noun: The quality of being c and even-tempered; composure.

She accepted their problems with grace and he with equanimity. Healy smiles, pleased with himself. Finishes with his shi Grabs his coat, exits the room... SLAM! In the foreground we see something he forgot -- Something shiny. His BRASS KNUCKLES.  16

Healy, on the way somewhere. Cruising up Laurel Canyon. As he nears a construction area -- POV HEALY: He sees a cute YOUNG GIRL. 14, maybe 15 years old-- Sees her snake beneath a chain-link fence. Once inside, she stands. Dusts herself off. Paces off 10 steps across the scorched, barren ground. 6 steps over, 3 back -- like following a treasure map. Healy, puzzled. This is really very odd behavior. She finds a specific spot. SITS. Composed. Takes out a BO Starts to read aloud. We have no idea why she's doing thi ANGLE ON HEALY, GOING BY... His gaze lingers a moment, curious. Then he turns the corner.

HEALY pulls up. Takes a slip of familiar NOTEPAD PAPER ou his pocket. It's PINK. And shaped like a COW. Checks it-- Then gets out of the car, whistling a tune. He crosses to slightly run down 50's-modern HOUSE. Patting his coat poc as he goes, looking for something: His brass knuckles. Gone. Shit. He shrugs it off. KNOCKS.
Just a minute..! Who is it?
Messenger service. Holland March home..? The door opens -- revealing none other than HOLLAND MARCH Distracted, scratching at the bandage on his wrist--
Hi. Healy SLUGS MARCH full in the face. March drops as though pole-axed. Healy steps past him. Inside. Shaking his hand in pain... Shuts the door. Looms over March. Poised like a dancer:
Mr. March, we're gonna play a game.
This is a mistake, you got the --OOOFF--!  17
It's called, "Shut up, unless you're me."
(gasping) I... I LOVE that game. Healy spots March's WALLET on a nearby counter. SLUGS him again for good measure, then crosses -- begins idly flipp through the wallet. Stops. Whistles low:
You're a private investigator? MARCH manages to sit up. Props himself against the wall.
Look... There's 30 bucks there. Take it.
I told you, I'm a messenger. (looks around) You afford this on a P.I.'s salary?
At night I'm a superhero. What's the message? Healy kneels down next to March--
Stop. Looking. For Amelia.
Fine. Hey. 'Nuff said. Put a fork in me. I'm done. Don't really put a fork in me.
(stands) That's fine, Mr. March. Amelia will be happy to hear you got the message. Almost done. Last thing..?
You wanna know who hired me to find her.
Bingo. Now, we can do this the easy way--
Her name's Glenn.
Or we can do this the hard way--  18
My client's name is Lily Glenn. She's an old woman. Thinks Amelia might be her niece... Hired me on Tuesday. Healy stops, momentarily thrown. March spits blood.
Anything else..?
You just gave up your client.
Well, I made a discretionary revelation--

No, you gave her up, just like that. Some poor old woman pays you good money and that's how you treat her..? March just shrugs. Supports himself on a coffee table... Stands. Slowly, painfully. Covertly slipping one hand int an OVERTURNED COOKIE JAR-- Comes up with a .38 SPECIAL. Spins toward Healy... Only Healy isn't where he was, he's dropped, he's on the ground, foot lashing out -- KICKING THE COFFEE TABLE. -- WHAM! -- the whole damn thing comes up from the ground SLAMS MARCH in the face. Knocks him back on his ass. Healy is on him in a flash. Grabs the gun. Dumps the shel Tosses it... Says, sadness in his voice:
I'm sorry you didn't get the message.
I get it now. I dig. I get it. Healy grabs March, wrenches his bandaged arm up behind hi back. Pins him against the wall.
Ow. Watch it there! I'm injured!
Listen, when you talk to your doctor, tell him you've got a spiral fracture of the right humerus... Got that?
Wait, wait... Jesus, man, STOP!  19
Deep breath. Healy twists March's arm PAST THE BREAKING POINT -- CRACK March screams as we SLAM-CUT TO:

Healy comes out the front door. A YOUNG GIRL, carrying a grocery bag, is headed the opposite way, swigging a drink It's the same girl he saw in the FENCED-OFF LOT earlier. This, we will come to realize, is March's daughter HOLLY.
Hi. Want a Yoo-Hoo?
A Yoo-Hoo..? Man, I haven't had one of those in about 10 years.
Knock yourself out. (hands him one) You a friend of my Dad's?
Business associate. He's inside. Resting. (vigorously shaking the bottle) Didn't I see you crawling around an empty lot a few blocks over..?
... Maybe... I read there sometimes. Healy nods. Takes a swig of his drink. Smiles.

"It's me-he for yoo-hoo!" (nods again, a beat) Well... Thanks. The girl waves. Walks up to the house. Healy gets into hi Takes another sip of Yoo-Hoo. Smiles. Drives off. CUT TO: A WHOLE DAMN CASE OF YOO-HOO. CLINK-ING as --
Healy lugs it down the sidewalk on Sunset. Pushes through small crowd of people waiting outside a CLUB.  20
Busy night. A BAD STAND-UP holds forth on the lighted sta

So you heard about this lawsuit..? L.A. is suing the automakers over the catalytic converter. (beat) Thing is, I don't see what all the fuss is about... I installed one on my car, nothing happened... Except, well, I turned into a Catholic. But that's it. The laughter is not deafening. Healy wrestles the Yoo-Hoos through an UNMARKED DOOR at t back of the club. Starts up a FLIGHT OF STAIRS -- Someone enters behind him. Healy looks back: TWO MEN. One's older, with horn-rimmed glasses and a brus cut. The other's in his twenties, feathered hair and gold chains. Back in the day, Richard Lynch would have played this guy. Don't know who that is? Shame on you.
Sorry, this area is private. Gold Chain ignores this. Starts up toward Healy. The Olde Guy closes the door at the base of the steps.
Wow. You got, like, an apartment up here?
Guys, if you're looking for a bathroom--
Nice try. We're looking for Amelia. A BLUR OF SILVER. GOLD CHAIN has a STEEL BATON. Healy can't react. Hands fu -- WHACK--! Down he goes. Yoo-hoo's SMASHING as we CUT TO
This is Lily Glenn. And she looks like she's about to cry
MARCH walks past camera. His right arm is in a CAST now.  21
Mrs. Glenn, let's be reasonable; this is a high profile case, your niece was a famous, um... actress. The head medical examiner himself ID'd the body--
I'm telling you, I SAW her, Mr. March. I didn't imagine it. I saw my Misty alive. (exasperated) I... I thought you said you found her...
No... I said I was tracking the girl you saw; doesn't mean it's your niece.
Why won't anyone believe me?
Mrs. Glenn, you were upset. You were at your dead niece's house, all those painful memories -- you just made a mistake, could happen to anybo--
I'm telling you, it was Misty. There was no mistake... I saw her through the front window--
Yes, you said--

--clear as day. She was wearing a blue pinstriped jacket. She was writing something... Then she came out and drove off before I could get her attention. (points) This was TWO DAYS after the accident! AFTER they said she went off that cliff! A pause. March takes a deep breath... Then:
Mrs. Glenn, Misty Mountains is dead... She died in that accident... I never should have taken your money in the first place. The old woman starts to cry. Chin set in feeble determination:  22

Even if it's for nothing... Even if this Amelia girl isn't my niece... I don't have anything else, do you understand..? Please, Mr. March -- please -- will you keep looking for her? For me? March sighs... Considering. Then looks the old lady directly in the eye and says:
No.
March climbs in the passenger side. Slams the door. A pau Holly sits in the driver's seat.
Holly... Am I a bad person? Holly picks at her nails, distracted.
... Yeah, pretty much.
(nods, then) Drive. Get me out of here. Holly puts it in gear.
Did you solve the case, dad?
... Sure. Yeah. Case closed.

WHAM--! Healy smacks against a wall. Then crumples as GOLD CHAIN enters frame. Looms over him. In the background OLDER GUY is tossing the place. Emptyin drawers. Throwing stuff... Gold Chain kneels next to Heal

Okay, sport, I'm asking you again... Where is Amelia? Healy makes himself sit up. He looks resigned, weary. He spots a pack cigarettes amongst the nearby debris. Grabs as a wave of LAUGHTER wafts up from the club below.  23

.».. Told you... I just don't know anyone named Amelia... I-- Gold Chain KICKS Healy in the gut, WHAM--! No warning. Fo sideways, retching. More LAUGHTER from the club below. Healy straightens again. In pain.
You don't talk, we're gonna have to start breaking your fingers. You understand.
I understand. OLDER GUY calls out:
Got some kind of hidden cabinet here! GOLD CHAIN turns, crosses the room. Starts pounding on th cabinet. Breaks it open. Inside is a heavy canvas BAG.

UM, YOU DON'T WANNA OPEN THAT... That's not mine. My friend wanted me to hold it for him... Trust me, don't-- GOLD CHAIN ignores Healy, rips the bag open-- AN EXPLOSION OF BLUE PAINT. Just like one of those charges they hide with bank money. Turns Gold Chain's face an impossible, shocking BLUE -- At which point, through the floor, comes the BIGGEST BUZZ YET of LAUGHTER... Like a sitcom soundtrack.
That's, um... that's not gonna come off. GOLD CHAIN snarls. Savagely wipes his face on towels. Crosses to the AQUARIUM, dips his face, scrubs--
Tried to tell you. Gold Chain stops. His still-blue face dripping wet.

What do you want with her? Holly's not sure how to handle this. Swallows, says:

She's... she's my sister, see. I need to warn her. Yeah, see, two freaky guys came around..? They're all, where is she, where is she -- Scared me, kinda. The Amazon scrutinizes her for a long moment...
Okay. You seem like a decent kid... (nods ) I'll take you to her.
»..- You'll, um... Oh. Kay.  53 Holly nods. Smiles. Her smile looks a tad sickly. CUT TO:
Our guys drag SHATTUCK'S BODY through the brush. Healy's got his legs. March has hold of an ugly tie. Both grunting. Sweating. Speaking in harsh whispers:
How the hell'd you spot him, that's what I'm wondering. From way up top..? (dawning realization) Wait a minute. You didn't... Did you FALL down that hill?
Oh, come on... I had three lousy drinks--
Sure. That's why you can't walk straight.
For Chrissakes, I'm carrying a dead body! I'm sorry I'm not Baryshnikov here--

Ha! You can't say "Baryshnikov!" You DID, you fell down here! Didn't you? (exasperated) Unbelievable. First you get drunk... Then you take a header off the balcony which, I'm sure, is a keen old-time detective trick--
Can we just get him out of sight, please? March indicates a sagging FENCE, separating properties. They plod toward it, wheezing with effort. PARTY NOISE, wafting on the night air.
Ready? On three; one... two... THREE. They heave the corpse over the top. It DROPS from view..!

At the end of the day? It's not their fault, I mean, real how could they know there was ANOTHER party at the neighbors'? Below the fence, 30 feet straight down? DEAD SHATTUCK plummets out of the sky and EXPLODES a glas table. Takes out a busboy. 150 people watch, thunderstruc  54
JESUS! MY LEG! Oh my God! My leg! Healy and March, uncomprehending. They peer over the fenc
I think he's still in sight. They BOOK. Back up the hill. Hit a set of wooden STEPS an keep right on climbing. CUT TO:
THE AMAZON leads Holly past the valet station. Down the street to a waiting LIMO. Engine idling.
Hop in back, sweetie. Holly swallows hard. Climbs in, heart thudding. There is man seated back here. Face turned, looking out the window The Amazon leans in after Holly, says:
This one says she's Amelia's sister. Then pulls back out, SLAMMING THE DOOR.
Is that a fact? He turns to look at Holly -- his face, a scrubbed but no less vivid shade of BLUE...
Good times.

With HEALY and MARCH, as they retreat up OUTSIDE STAIRS. Pushing through people, shoving them aside. March reaches a wooden LANDING: Deck, hot tub. Lunges for the NEXT set of stairs. Healy appears, close on his heels. Turns towards the stai accidentally SLAMS into a big guy. Starts to apologize -- FREEZES. Dead stop. We recognize the BYSTANDER. It's OLDER GUY. Blue-Face's partner. Big as life. Their eyes lock.... They launch. NO HESITATION. March, everyone else, forgott  55 Older Guy's .38, clearing leather -- Healy KICKS OUT--! Sends it sailing. It lands in the HOT TUB. Older Guy counters: PULLS A SWITCHBLADE. Lunges. PANDEMONIUM. The deck clears rapidly. People SCREAMING. Running every which way, surging up the stairs and meanwh
HOLLY pressed back up against the door of the limo. Feeli behind her for the door handle.
- No thanks. I think we must be talking about a different Amelia. Blue Face inching towards her. Voice deadly calm:
Really..? How can you be sure? Why don't you describe your sister for-- Suddenly he stops. Breaks off mid-sentence, staring past out the window. Holly darts a look herself, sees--

head_text.subj: A GIRL IN A YELLOW DRESS

text: Bolts out of the front door of Shattuck's house. Frantic. Trailing a backpack. Accosting the VALET. YELLING:

I need my keys. Now. My keys, HURRY--! Her words, clearly audible. BLUE FACE flicks a glance at the seat across from him. Holly, following his gaze again: A FADED PHOTOGRAPH sits there. It's a shot of AMELIA. The woman we saw hire Healy. Looki slightly younger with a graduation cap and tassel... OUT THE WINDOW: The GENUINE ARTICLE. No mistaking her. Blue-Face just won the lottery. Everything changes, that quick. Holly, now worthless. Blue-Face lunges ACROSS her. Thrusts open the DOOR, pinning Holly in the process.
Don't fucking move.  56
In his outstretched fist. He sights down the barrel. This is it, he's not fucking around. And you know what..? Holly decides she isn't either. Fuck being scared. She wrenches one arm free--

head_text.subj: GRABS THE DOOR AND YANKS IT SHUT

text: Right on Blue-Face's wrist. A loud CRUNCH--! He BARKS sudden PAIN. The gun bucks in his hand. DISCHARGES, KA-POW--! Shot goes wild. Blasts splinters from the valet box. BLUE FACE recoils and HOLLY kicks the door back open. Leaping from the car--

Amelia, run!! Amelia SPINS. Locks eyes with Holly... BOLTS like a cheet PANIC. People yelling, rushing for cover. Holly stumbles, gains her feet as Blue-Face fumbles with the gun, reachin for her-- This time she slams the door ON HIS FINGER. PAIN, white-hot. He shrieks, falls back inside the car. Holly doesn't miss a beat-- SHE RUNS FOR IT. Heart thudding, feet slapping pavement. Chasing a blotch of retreating YELLOW, as Amelia flees do the canyon. The party's become a ROUT.
MARCH heading up the STAIRS fast-- following the sound of the GUNSHOT. The wood, vibrating... thrumming. He looks u
Fuck me. Panicked PARTY GUESTS. STAMPEDING DOWN towards him, as be him they STAMPEDE UP. He fights through, bursts out--
Onto the drive. Casts about --

57 BLUE-FACE at the wheel. Laying rubber. People actually FL themselves aside-! IT SCREECHES off, down the canyon. March turns -- the VALET who parked his car earlier gives him a slightly surprised look:
Hey, man, I think that limo is going after the girl who was in your trunk! Far out, huh?
My trunk--? (realizing) Oh, fuck. FUCK..! (beat) Where the hell are my keys?!

The DECK, now empty after the exodus. HEALY and OLDER GUY. Still at it. Circling each other. OLDER GUY darts in quickly, brandishing the knife. HEALY scrambles back -- Stumbles against the HOT TUB. A glint of METAL in the water. THE GUN. Healy dodges a SLASH -- DIVES for the weapon. Comes up, soaking wet, spins to FIRE -- Too late. Because OLDER GUY'S already ON TOP OF HIM. Tackles him. STABBING. As they both PITCH BACKWARD -- Over the EMBANKMENT. Tumbling, bouncing. DOWN THE WOODED HILLSIDE. Skipping, end over end. Kicking up dirt -- Then WHAM--! WHAM--! the two men slam to an abrupt STOP i the middle of a clearing. Twenty yards apart. Healy groggy, bleeding, wet... The REVOLVER'S GONE. He spots it to his left. Tries to stand. Collapses. SCRAMBLES for the gun. Hands and knees. Snatches it up and AIMS IT before Older Guy can even get his feet. PULLS THE TRIGGER: CLICK--! Older Guy FLINCHES -- Nothing. It's a misfire. Healy pulls the trigger twice more --  58

It won't fire. He gets it immediately: The cartridges are Older Guy smiles. He's still got the knife. He starts for Healy. Oh, Shit. Frantically, Healy flips the GUN CYLINDER open. Spins it as fast as he can. Water flying off the thing. Flicks it back into place. Aims. Older Guy ten yards away

Fuck. Healy tries to stand and back up at the same time. Falls again. Fuck. Flicks the cylinder open. Spins it. Desperate. Blows on it this time-- Older Guy is almost on him. He flicks the cylinder closed
Older Guy SWINGS THE KNIFE--

MUZZLE FLASH. Close range. The bullet catches Older Guy i the collar bone. SHATTERS IT. Blood and flesh go flying. Older Guy SCREAMS, spun like a top. Goes down flailing. The shot echoes in the canyon closeness. HEALY drops his arm to his side. Chest heaving. There. Much better. Tosses the gun. Spits blood. Steels himself. Staggers to his feet. Half-limping now. Kicks the knife away. Looms over Older Guy.
(wheezing) Wait... You don't... I can pay you. I can pay y-- Healy rears back and STOMPS the guy's elbow. We hear a SHARP SNAP and the man SCREAMS again. SQUIRMING
Are you bargaining with me? Older Guy shakes his head emphatically.
No... No... I'm gone... You'll never... see me again... Never...  59 Healy takes the KNIFE. Holds it an INCH from the guy's EY
Uh-huh. Where will you be?
Mi... Michigan... Healy considers a beat. Then, surprisingly, nods.

Michigan works. Withdraws the knife. Staggers upright. Was it worth it? He'll worry about that later. Turns, starts uphill -- the just as suddenly STOPS. Ears pricked: A SCREECH OF TIRES from down the canyon.

We can see A ROAD below us, through the trees. Healy spots two figures RUNNING. They dodge across the tarmac. Start down a wooded SLOPE. Getting OFF THE ROAD. Behind them, A LIMO SHRIEKS TO A STOP. A MAN jumps out, pulling a gun. Hard to say from this distance, but it looks like his face might be BLUE. Healy galvanizes. Powers forward. Running on his hurt leg Older Guy, forgotten -- and meanwhile

He takes a corner full-speed. UP AHEAD-- THE LIMO. Angled in the middle of the road. BLUE-FACE aiming a gun down the canyon. FIRING. No hesitation. March VEERS. Targeting Blue-Face. Stomps the accelerator. Engine, howling..! BLUE-FACE reacts to the noise. Doesn't miss a beat. Spins and FIRES RIGHT AT MARCH. WINDSHIELD, splintered..! March ducks. SKIDDING. OUT OF CONTROL. Blue-Face DIVES aside, nick of time, as MARCH'S CAR - Fishtails. Slews off the road...  60 Just misses a full-grown DEER. Sends it SCAMPERING. A TREE RUSHES AT US. March slams it HEAD ON... WHAM--! Silence. A beat. March shakes his head. Clearing it. Turn BLUE-FACE is gone. Down the hillside. March blinks, and then-- Someone ELSE flashes across the road, limping:
Healy doesn't stop. Hobbles, yelling back, pointing:
See if you can cut him off! Go! Shit. March jams it in reverse. Pulling free. Takes off a
Holly and Amelia stumble down onto another paved road. Am clutching her BACKPACK. Both running for their lives--
Go! Run! What happens next happens quickly:
Emerges from the trees behind them. Stops, drawing a bead Amelia. His finger tenses on the trigger, as
Ten feet away. Leaping into the road. It's the one that March spooked. It fetches up sharply, seeing Blue-Face -- At which point, inexplicably, we make a HARD CUT TO:

head_text.subj: THE INTERIOR OF A FAMILY SEDAN

text: DAD, driving a tad fast, whips around a corner. From the back seat, his son YELLS:

Dad cries out, SWERVES--! Misses the deer, thank God. Hits BLUE-FACE instead.  61 Just fucking nails him--! FLINGS him, limbs skewed, into air... He lands with a sickening THUD--! CUT TO: HOLLY -- Still running. Shoots a look back. Sees the CAR come to a SKITTERING STOP. Sees THE DAD get out... Stare Then HOP BACK in his car and take off. Leaving BLUE-FACE lying there, in the middle of the road. His leg, twisted back at an impossible angle... Holly stops... Hesitates...
What the hell are you doing?!
He's HURT. Just... just hang on! She starts back toward him. Amelia calling after her:

Are you crazy?! Stay away from him! Holly just keeps going. Onto the road. Approaches the downed man-- He's a mess. He rolls over, gasping... SEES HOLLY. Stops. Holly stares back at him... Turns to call to Amelia -- Sees her RETREATING at a dead run. Goodbye. BLUE-FACE, meanwhile, is out of it... He reaches out a ha for her... She makes a decision. Crouches, takes his hand
It's okay... you're gonna be alright... I'll get help. A RUSTLING sound. Holly spins, startled-- HEALY is standing behind her. Staring down at BLUE-FACE.
A car hit him, we need an ambulance..!
Right. He strips off his sliced up jacket, lays it across Blue-F

Holly, go flag someone down... Hurry, he's in a bad way. Holly scurries off. Healy and Blue-Face, alone now.  62 He looms over the prone figure. For a moment, Blue-Face turns his eyes upward at Healy, imploring -- then, with dawning recognition:
You... Healy regards him, detached.
Me. Blue Face coughs... Fixes Healy with a belligerent grin:
Too late... The word already went out on you and the private cop... Ever hear... of John Boy..? By now, he's... heard of you... You ain't got long to live. Healy shrugs philosophically.
Nobody does. He reaches out a powerful hand; calmly, clinically...
HOLLY comes running back down the road. Desperate, fluste
Healy! No one's stopping! Healy stands over BLUE-FACE'S BODY. Slipping his jacket back on:

Sorry... He didn't make it. Holly shifts her gaze to the corpse. Stunned. Casually, Healy leans down, starts rifling the dead man's clothing. Comes up with a WALLET. Checks the license: Seymour Jones. Detroit, Michigan. He frowns at that... Just as HEADLIGHTS SWEEP them. Healy quickly tosses the wallet, as RED AND BLUE flashers fill the night --
And that would be the cops.  63 Holly doesn't even look up. She can't stop staring at the body in the road. CUT TO:
POLICE CARS, skewed across the roadway. A COP routes traffic, past the accident site -- BLUE FACE'S BODY is loaded into an ambulance.
Healy leans against it, calmly smoking. While March argue the UNIFORMED OFFICER, standing guard:
Look, you got our statements. Can I talk to my kid now or what? She's over with the nurse.
Sir, I was told to keep you here. So I'm keeping you here. Just following orders.

(indignant) Yeah, well... Hitler was just following orders! Healy thinks about correcting March -- but really, what's point..? Right then, a WOMAN appears at the cop's side. She's dark. Dark hair. Dark eyes. And beautiful. Late 20s early 30s. She wears a crisp, tailored business suit. As soon as she arrives, the cop gives her a quick nod and departs. Just like that... The woman smiles at March:
You're Mr. March, I think. (to Healy) And you are..?
Not answering that question.
(slight shrug) My name is Tally. If you'll come with me..? My boss would like a word. March and Healy just exchange looks. Follow warily, as sh leads them to a black SEDAN. Stops, waits, as --
64 Revealing ANOTHER WOMAN. Late 40's. Well kept.
Gentlemen. How do you do?
About this bad, most of the time.
My name is Judith Kuttner. I work for the California Department of Justice.
I see... Well, that explains exactly nothing. What the hell's all this about? Why are you holding us?
Please, keep your voice down. I'm trying to be discrete here... (pause, deep breath) I'm Amelia's mother.
L.A. continues to dazzle. Clouds awash with the glitter f below. TALLY plays a game with HOLLY in the background. A
Sit at a picnic table. Talking. The SEDAN shields them fr the road. Kuttner nervously lights a smoke... There's a snapshot of Amelia on the table.
First off, I want to thank you. From the interviews we're getting, it sounds like you might have saved my daughter's life.
That was mostly Holly. Kuttner glances back at Holly. Chews her lip. Thinking...
I need your help. And I'm wondering if I can really trust you.
Most people don't... But I'm starting to get the idea you don't have much of a choice. Kuttner regards March... Makes a decision.  65
My situation is... well, "delicate" is putting it mildly. My job can be very public sometimes -- Healy frowns -- then suddenly snaps his fingers:
That's where I've seen you before -- on TV. Prosecuting that car company thing.
The lawsuit over the catalytic converter. Exactly. That's half my day. (beat) The other half I spend on pornography.
Really..? That makes two of us.
You may have noticed that Hollywood Boulevard has devolved into a cesspool. Not to give cesspools a bad name.
So you're, like, an anti-porn crusader?
More or less... The Vegas mob is looking to expand their porn apparatus to L.A. I'm doing everything I can to stop that--
Right. Porn is bad, yes, we get it -- (breaks off, squints) -- Wait... Your daughter made a Sid Shattuck film. Kuttner nods. Stares off:
Ouch... Ma'am, no offense -- but why'd Amelia do this film, if she knew it could embarrass you?
Oh, that's what she wanted. She's a petulant child, she... lashed out. Since her father died we've had... a difficult relationship.  She stubs 66
So, there's a film out there, somewhere. A prime piece of blackmail.
That would be my worry, except for one small detail -- (beat) There is no film. Not anymore. out her cigarette.
It's been destroyed... There was a fire, Amelia's friend, boyfriend, whatever he was--
Dean. Yeah. We've been to the house.
This Dean was apparently editing the film when the fire started -- all the footage burned. Everything.
A great loss to cinema, I'm sure. That begs the question: (beat) Mrs. Kuttner, why is everyone who worked on that film now dying?
I don't know, Mr. March. I wish I did. All I know is Amelia is in danger.
So put her in protective custody. After tonight she'll get scared, come running home--

No. She won't. You don't understand-- (sudden tears) I know how she thinks. She doesn't trust me. I'm... Big Brother. I'm the government. (beat) She thinks it's me doing all this. The implications of this set in. She wipes her eyes.  67
My daughter is out there, running scared. And she can't call home... because she thinks her own mother is trying to kill her. She reaches into her bag. Takes out a CHECKBOOK.
I want to hire you. Both of you. Find Amelia. Protect her.
We see the sum take shape -- T-E-N THOUSA--
Hire us? Sure. But we don't come cheap. (smug) I'm thinking five thousand dollars. She stops writing. Pause... She rips up the check. Starts writing again. March grins triumphantly at Healy. CUT TO:
Healy stands back here. Staring at the half empty pool. Smoking... March comes out through the sliding glass door
She's asleep now. She's fine. Healy nods. March kicks a beachball into the pool.
Listen, something bothers me... (frowns ) Kuttner's prosecuting this car company thing, right? Could mean hundreds of millions against the big three.
Yeah. So?
That guy tonight, the Blue-face one... Got a look at his ID. (beat) He's from Detroit.
... Probably nothing. Healy nods... Then:  68
Oh, I almost forgot... He reaches into his coat. Takes out the COW-SHAPED paper found at the party.
I found this in Shattuck's office. (reads ) 28-10 Burbank Apt. Western, Flight 2. 10:30 pm... I think Amelia wrote this. March glances at it: 28-10 BURBANK APT. WEST, FLT 2, 10:3
She might be trying to skip town -- what do you think? March shakes his head, a beat --
I think whatever it is, it can wait. I need 8 hours... (beat) Just drop by in the afternoon tomorrow. We'll sort it all out.
Healy, driving away from March's house. He spots somethin out the side window, squints:
We can just make out the beam of a FLASHLIGHT -- held by small figure sitting in the dirt... Reading from a book. Healy, bewildered. He hits the brakes and we CUT TO:
Sitting Indian style in the middle of the vacant lot -- t exactly where we first met her... She reads out loud to n Healy steps into frame behind Her... She stops reading bu doesn't look up:
Hey.
Hey. Healy glances around. No one else here.  69
You've got your foot in the toilet.
~.. What?
(turns) Your foot. It's in the toilet.
Oh. Healy takes a couple of steps forward.
You just knocked over the lamp.
Right. Sorry... Was this your room?
«+. No. Mom and Dad's. Healy nods: Oh.
«++. Mom loved detective stories. She closes the book. Takes a deep lungful of night air.
Aren't you supposed to be in bed?
I couldn't sleep.
I see. (nods ) ... Then I'll leave you to it. Healy turns to leave... Heads back to his car.
Mr. Healy..? Can I ask you something? Healy stops, looks back:
Anything.
... What did you do to that man tonight?  70
What. .?
On the road... When I went to go get help. What did you do?
I... Nothing.
You didn't... (pause) .».. Did you kill him?
No... Of course not. I -- of course not. She studies him a moment longer. Finally nods: she believ
Okay... That's good... (little smile) ... I knew you couldn't do something like that... Goodnight, Mr. Healy.

As Healy gets back into his car. Keys the ignition. Catches sight of himself in the rearview mirror: Notices something he hadn't before... Something troubling He shakes it off -- Puts the car in gear. Drives away... And we CUT TO BLACK. Darkness. Silence. A count of FOUR, FADE UP. A TV NEWSCAST. A SLICK, WELL DRESSED MAN being interviewed. As workers in the background set up tables.
I'm here with a representative of the Detroit Auto Manufacturers, Mr. Bergen Paulsen... Mr. Paulsen, I understand you're in town today getting ready for the Auto show--

That's right, Mike. For thirty years, it's been my privilege to debut the finest in automotive technology. Right here in L.A. The CAMERA starts to pull back from the TV set now.  71 We're inside Healy's apartment. The TV drones on, unnotic The reporter asking about the catalytic converter lawsuit Healy walks past frame. Fresh from the shower. Hair tousl We follow him over to his "word of the day" calendar: Internecine \In.ter.ne.cine\, adj: Pertaining to dissenti within a group; mutually destructive. He ponders a moment, then says out loud:
The marriage failed when their internecine struggle overwhelmed what love remained. He smiles, satisfied. Shrugs on his coat. Exits whistling
Healy sits on the front porch. Waiting. Smoking. MARCH'S CAR pulls into the driveway. March and Holly clim out. She's carrying packages. March carries a new suit.
Hey.
Hey, hey! The man of the hour! They approach Healy.
Didn't know what time you'd be here. You said the afternoon--
Right. Sure. Sorry... But I went to the bank. Got your money. Right here. He pulls out an envelope.
That's all of it. Half. Twenty-five hundred... Yep... (beat) You know, minus a couple hundred... Damage to the car... I figured you'd want to chip in for that. Healy just shrugs it off.
Sure.  72
What do you think..? March holds up his suit, proudly. It's maroon.
Nice... I guess. Holly pushes past Healy. She does not look happy.
We stopped at a bar. That's why we're late. She darts inside the house.
Right... So, uh, how you wanna do this?
Well... I think we, you know, give it a couple of days... Then we'll call Kuttner, see if we can hit her up for a second installment.
We can -- I mean... What..?
You don't want to call too soon. Gotta act like you're on to something, been working hard... Then wammo. (beat) I'm good at this. Trust me. He heads into the house. Healy turns, follows him inside:
Wait, you're just gonna... lie to her?
Yeah. (off Healy's expression) What?
She paid us. ME. She paid me to do a job... I don't wanna lie to her.

Fine. I'll lie to her. (beat) Don't worry. This is a good thing. We're gonna get some free bread.  73 March hits play on his answering machine. He's got two messages. Both from Lily Glenn, Misty's aunt: LILY (on machine) Mr. March, this is Lily Glenn. I haven't heard from you about Misty's case-- March fast forwards it: LILY (on machine) Mr. March, I really want to find out if you've made progress-- March deletes both messages. Uninterested... Looks up:
Right. So, we good?
Good..? No, we're not good. (beat) Look, we have theses clues to follow -- He fishes out the COW-SHAPED PAPER he got off Blue Face.
Burbank Airport? Western flight 2? I'm thinking she's skipping town --
Great! Fine! She gets shot in another city. We're off the hook. Healy turns, starts to walk back out the front door.
Forget it. Just then, HOLLY appears from down a hallway. March doesn't see her. Neither does Healy. March follows Healy, reaches for his shoulder --
Wait, wait. Just one Goddamn secon-- Healy SHOVES HIM. March stumbles, knocking trash and beer bottles off the coffee table. Lands on his ass... Sits in spilled beer, pitiful.
I'll find these guys myself. I don't need a pathetic idiot.  74

Oh, you don't need a pathetic idiot. Ahhh, see, I had it confused -- March glances over at that exact second. LOCKS EYES with daughter. The look on her face stops him cold: She's ashamed of him. Healy on his way out the door, says:
You're the world's worst detective.
.».. Yeah, but I got a really cool ad. Then, just before Healy's gone, March makes a decision --
Hey, Healy -- say 'Hi' to Amelia for me.
I will.
‘Course, you won't have much luck at the airport... Seeing as it's not a flight. Healy hesitates, turns back... March shrugs:
Your note. It's not a flight. Look at it. Healy looks at it: 28-10 BURBANK APT. WEST, FLT 2, 10:30 March gets to his feet... Speaks unerringly from memory:

Most airports -- Burbank included -- have nighttime overflight curfews. 10 to 6. Plus that first number? It's today's date, reversed the European way -- which makes sense when you see FLT. That's not flight. My guess? It's flat. As in apartment. Pause. Healy stands, thunderstruck. Licks his lips, think
And Burbank APT. West..?
The Burbank Apartments West. I've driven past it a few times. It's a dump.  75 He gets up. Sighs. Turns to Holly:
We're going now. And you're going to Jessica's. For real this time.

Healy slews his car to a stop along a deserted-looking bl on Vineland... Healy and March clamber out. Look around. Only there's nothing here. A gas station. An empty lot. AN ELDERLY MAN is out walking his dog. Healy hails him:
‘Evening. We're, uh, looking for the Burbank Apartments..?

(points to empty lot) Used to be there. Tore those puppies down, going on two years now. He walks on. Leaves March and Healy just standing there. A pause. Another pause. Then March turns to Healy and say
So. The airport, then..?
Above us, a BOEING 737 climbs skyward. Wingtips blinking
Healy and March rocket past, doing eighty.
Healy at the wheel. Speeding. Racing against time.

Well, they used to have those overflight restrictions. I read all about ‘em. So, okay, maybe they changed them, but if they did then that's... that's just wrong. Healy is just ignoring him. Fuming. March decides it's be to drop it. Stares out the side window. Squints, then:
Hey, she's not going to the airport.  76
What. .? March points out the window.
Pull over. Healy glances over:
Look, I've had it to here with your -- (stops) What? What are you pointing at?
The car glides to the curb, and the two men stare silentl at this vision before them... Healy whistles: A FIFTEEN-STORY GLASS AND STEEL TOWER. Rising up from an expanse of asphalt. On a huge MARQUEE:
And underneath: Visit "THE FLIGHT LOUNGE" Disco 1 & 2 Healy just shakes his head.
West is Westin. She's not leaving town.
(nods ) She's meeting someone.
MARCH AND HEALY hurry through the faux-maritime Mecca tha is the AIRPORT WESTIN. Locate the FLIGHT LOUNGE.
For the moment, no one but the bartender, JOE. Our guys belly up to the bar --
"Evening. What can I get you?
Information. Ever see this girl? He props a snapshot of AMELIA on the bar. Joe frowns:  77
Looks familiar. You guys cops?
In spirit. She woulda come in, like, last half hour..?
Hey. I just work here.
I know, dickhead, that's why I'm asking. Maybe ordered something wacky, say, a bourbon martini..? Bingo. We see the spark of recognition:
Riiiight... Could be. Memory gets foggy, you know? What's in it for me?
(indicates Healy) He'll stop doing it.
Doing what? Healy grabs Joe's TIE, yanks--! Bounces his head off the
That.
OW! Fuck.
Listen -- Joe, is it? (reading nametag) We really need to find her.
Yeah. And Joe, we can do this the easy way, or-- oh, wait, this is the easy way. Healy reaches for Joe again --
Okay! Jesus. What ever happened to offering me twenty bucks?
We're in a recession. The girl?  Healy and Healy and Red flag. 78
The PENTHOUSE. Top floor. (massages his forehead) She's in the penthouse. There. You happy?
She's there now.
Sure, yeah, but listen -- you guys don't wanna go up there, trust me.
Why? Who's there?
These New York guys. Business guys, whatever -- point is, they got fucking bodyguards. Mohammed types -- you know the kind, had their balls removed. What's that called?
Marriage.
Anyway, he booked the penthouse. March exchange glances:
What the hell is she up to..?
(pleading) Guys, no one wants trouble. She's gotta come back down. Can't you just... hang here, have a couple cold ones on me? March mull it over. Why not?
There. See? Very reasonable. Your buddy, that was the problem, he wasn't reasonable -- HEALY picks up on it instantly:
Say again. Our buddy..?
The other guy, yeah, come round lookin' for Amelia -- he wasn't with you?  719
Describe him. He have a name?
No name. Big fucker. Blonde. Like a Nebraska boy, corn-fed, you know?
Where'd he go?
Got on the elevator. Right before you came in.
You witnessed this.
No, it was told to me by a wise old Indian, of course I fucking witnessed it. (stands) I'll grab you a couple beers. He exits. HEALY chews on that. Says without looking up:
Could be... Makes sense... John Boy.
Who. .?
Some guy Blue Face mentioned.
Mentioned? Mentioned how?
You know: "This man is coming to kill you..." That kinda crap.
What?!
Big, farm-looking motherfucker. .? (beat, shakes his head) Shit, what am I talking about..? We don't even know what John Boy looks like. March is starting to look panicked.  80
Look, all we gotta do is wait, right..? She comes down, we grab her, ta-da.
I suppose. Unless he's up there now, murdering her. They both sit there, pointedly not looking at each other.
Not worth getting shot over.
You wouldn't think. He rubs tired eyes. Lets out a long, ragged breath.
Okay. Here we go. March's face registers the sort of undistilled misery onl true coward can appreciate.

Healy and March step inside the elevator. March presses "P". They ascend. It's a glass elevator, you can see the city outside. They stare at the elevator doors. They've seen the city. New Age MUZAK, serene. All of life's rough edges, blunted
(abruptly) Munich.
What?
That's it, right? What you call a guy, had his nuts removed? A Munich? Healy slips on his brass knuckles. Flexes his hand.
Munich is a city in Germany.
Oh. (brightens) Hitler only had one ball.  81

Yeah, I'd heard that. (watching the floor indicator) Okay, here we go. They face forward. Shoulders squared. Ready for anything. The elevator glides to a stop, ding--! The doors open. They're both about to exit, when-- LAUGHTER fills the corridor. Healy frowns, listening. Wheezing, asthmatic laughter -- the kind, you think you'r gonna pass out, the joke's so fucking funny. HEALY leans out, cautiously... Just in time to see

Stumbling toward him. Weaving, side to side. Equilibrium, gone. Wheeze... Stumble... Healy draws a sharp breath: From the guy's collar, a sad little spritz. Wheeze..! Like a kids' drinking fountain. Bright blood. Arterial. HIS THROAT'S BEEN CUT. Guy collides with the wall. Eyes, pleading with Healy...
These from the OTHER direction. MARCH stares, eyes wide -

Comes rocketing out of a side corridor. Headed their way Three loud, sharp REPORTS. BULLETS rip through his mid-section--! The window behind him, cracked. Splattered. He SCREAMS an the WHEEZER keeps on wheezing and all is blood and chaos HEALY doesn't say a word. Never changes expression. Leans back into the elevator. Reaches past March -- Pushes the "Lobby" button. The doors glide shut, erasing the corridor.

The gut-shot MAN bursts through the picture window. Tumbles past the elevator --  82 Inside, Muzak plays, soothing. Healy slides the brass knuckles off. Stashes them in a pocket. Their visit to the penthouse, 15 seconds in duration. You know, it was never all that hot of an idea.
(looking ill) Feels... like I'm gonna...
Don't even think about it.
Squealing up out of the parking garage. Onto the street. Getting the fuck out of there. Fast.
March presses his forehead to the side window. His face, a study in despair... Without looking up:
Cops. Sure enough, STROBING RED, BLUE -- painting the buildings Without missing a beat, Healy swerves into an alley behin the Westin. Pulls over. Kills the ignition... Pause.
You know, the thing is --

Shut up. They sit. Checking the mirror. Saying nothing... The cops get farther away. Crickets resume chirping. Pause... the tension, palpable. March opens his mouth to wrap things up -- Something lands on the car. HARD. WHAM--! Buckles the roof. What in the name of God..? March claws for his weapon, then FREEZES as
Appear. On the WINDSHIELD.  83 Hearts in their throats, our guys swap glances.
What the fu--?? FEET. Walking down the windshield...
Hobbles into view. Torn dress. Cuts, scratches. Poised at the hood, eyes crazed, hair wild --

The moppet in the windshield SPINS, startled. Executes a little burlesque for their benefit: They watch, oddly detached, as she raises a BERETTA she's been clutching and BLASTS a shot through the windshield. KA-POW! The seat cushion blooms stuffing, as--

Goes over backwards. Tumbles from sight. Out of frame. Ju like that. Gunsmoke, hanging in the air. Silence. They both sit there. By unspoken assent, they clamber from the car, one on eac side. Find her splayed flat on her back. Unconscious. March glances up at the FIRE ESCAPE they've parked under. Looks at Healy. The wind blows. SIRENS...

THE FRONT DOOR bursts open. March and Healy enter. Carryi the half-conscious AMELIA between them. HOLLY is in the living room playing TV PONG with her frie JESSICA. She jumps to her feet, surprised to see them:
Holy shit, you got her! March is equally surprised to see his daughter.

What the hell are you doing here? You're supposed to be at Jessica's!  84 They walk/drag Amelia through the living room and into Holly's room. Lay her on the bed. Holly and Jessica tag along behind them.
Sorry, Mr. March, my sister kicked us out. She was having some guy over, didn't want us around.
(still pissed) Yeah... Well... Your sister's a slut.
I know. On the bed, Amelia's eyes flutter open. She squints.
Feel well enough to talk? We got some questions. She shifts her gaze to Healy. Eyes focusing.
You were... You were supposed to get these guys off of me.
Amelia, do you know what they want? Who sent them?
Yeah. I know... It was my mother. March and Healy exchange looks.
Why don't you start from the top? Amelia shuts her eyes again. Tired.
Why? It doesn't matter. It-- (stops, sighs, then) I... made a film... With Dean, my boyfriend. The idea was we'd do this... artistic, uh, film. Experimental film--
Porno film? Amelia's eyes snap back open.  Pause. 85
It's not a porno! Look, do you know who my mother is?
Yes. We've met her. We talked to her.
(bitter) What'd she tell you..? That I was a loon? That I was lashing out?
Something like that.
Yeah, well... My mother is a criminal. She's one of them.
Them..? Who's them?

She's one of the insiders. She's one of the capitalist, corporate suppressors. (getting worked up) She's one of the elite fear-mongers. And her and her pig cronies have us in the cross-hairs. We're just pawns, man! They're trying to kill us all!
Gosh.
So, you're saying your mother is... bad?
-.. Yes.
Does this have anything to do with the birds? Amelia lets her head fall back again. Closing her eyes.
My mother is supposed to be working for the Justice Department, right?
Sure. She's prosecuting that car thing.  86
Yeah. Only she's not... I mean, she's not prosecuting it. The automakers..? She's gonna let ‘em walk.
But... they have evidence--

Sure, they have evidence. They've got memos proving Detroit conspired to suppress the converter. Proving they'd rather poison our air than spend a little money... (warming again) But my mother's gonna say it's not enough to convict. She's gonna lie. She's on the take. Money, again, right? Mammon, that's her god. That FASCIST, CAPITALIST --
(cutting in) Okay, okay..! Back up. How do you know this? Amelia calms again.
I was spying on her... I listened in on her phone calls.
So why didn't you just go to the police?
She is the police! She's the head of the Justice Department!
Then to a newspaper.
(exasperated) Look, these people all work together! You been living under a rock?
So you decided to make a... porno film?
It's not a porno. We made a statement. And yes, it contained nudity --  87
And porn stars..?

That's just the commercial element. Okay? Sid said we had to have that... The reality was, we were gonna get our message out there... It was all in the film. Names. Dates. Everything. Everything my mom was doing. Once it got out, once it was in theaters there was no way they could suppress it. No way to cover it up.
I just want to get this straight. You made a porno -- where the important part was the plot?
What's your hang-up, man?
So, it's not about the actors, the sex, nothing. It's the fucking story? That's what you're telling us? Amelia nods, calming again.
... My mom found out about it. Killed Dean. Destroyed all his work...
Your mom killed Dean?
Of course. She killed Misty, too.
And Sid Shattuck?
Yeah. March nods.
So, it's like, uh, Jack the Ripper and then your mom.
So what are you gonna do?  88
... I don't know... I haven't figured it out yet... (leans back, eyes flutter) I'm just tired now. I'm tired.
Right... Well, we'll think on it. You, uh, get some rest. They all step out of the room. Close the door.
What do you think..?
I like her!
I like her dress.
I think she's a loon. According to her, her mother is single-handedly taking down all of western society.
(nods ) Yeah. People do want to kill her though... Like John Boy.
Maybe he heard her talk for five minutes.
Who's John Boy?
He's on "The Waltons."
This is a different John Boy.
We think. The phone in the kitchen starts to RING. March gets it.
This is March.
89 Judith Kuttner's assistant. She stands in the middle of a well-appointed study at Kuttner's house.
Mr. March, this is Tally... I don't know who else to call.
Tally..? What's going on?
I don't know quite how to say this. So I'll just say it -- I think Judith, Mrs. Kuttner, I think she may be involved in something... How do I put it...
Illegal..?
I wouldn't go that far. Shady. Maybe.
Well, her kid certainly seems to think so.
Amelia? Did you talk to her? Is she safe?
Yeah. She's here now. A little banged up, but still intact. (beat) She thinks her mom is a one woman crime spree.

That's insane. Whatever Judith's doing, it's to benefit Amelia, bet on it -- still... (plunges in) I just got a call from her... She wouldn't explain herself. But she said she needed $100,000 dollars in cash.
Why?
I don't know. I think she's in trouble. She sounded... scared.
Scared?  90
I can send the family doctor to look after Amelia, if-- (pause) Mr. March, would you be willing to carry the money for me?
Carry the money..?
I don't know where else to turn. And I'm worried about Judith... Will you help?
March and Healy lean against March's car. Waiting for Tal March finishes a cigarette. Checks his watch.
Tally should be here any minute.
(nods absently) Wish I knew who to believe on this thing.
Tell you what, that kid's a write-off.
She's misguided.
She's NUTS. She won't be happy ‘til there's a bird in the White House. A pause... Then Healy shrugs.
Maybe they're both telling the truth.
What does that mean?

(frowns, then) I had this friend, right? In the Secret Service. Worked the Nixon detail -- this was after they threw him outta office... (beat) Anyway, one day Nixon is out driving, down near San Clemente. Just him and a few agents. (MORE )

And they come upon this accident, first ones on the scene. Guy pinned under his own car. So, NIXON gets out, RUNS to the guy's side to check on him... Nixon says to him, "You're gonna be fine, son. You're gonna be okay." But then, the guy just dies, right there. Pause. March has a vaguely constipated look on his face.
I don't get it.

Just look at it from the other guy's point of view. The guy that died... He's out, driving along one day. Gets ina horrible accident. And he's laying there, near death. Staring up at the sky... And former president RICHARD NIXON appears to him... Tells him he's gonna be fine. (beat) What did that guy think? Did he think this was normal..? You know, that everyone sees Nixon before they die--
You're expecting an angel, you get this shit.
Right... Same situation... Just looks vastly different depending on your point of view. That's what I'm saying.
It all just depends on your point of view.
Sure. Right--
--how you look at it.
Yeah. What's wrong..?

For Chrissakes, you tell me this epic fucking story, and ten minutes later the point is there's two ways of looking at things? Why not save time and say, "There's two ways of looking at things."  92 Healy just shrugs. March rubs his eyes. Tired. Lights another cigarette.
..-. Be kind of a bummer, that's what death was like. Healy nods...
Could be worse... Could be Agnew.
Pulls up along side them. TALLY gets out. Carrying a LARG METAL SUITCASE. She sets it on the hood of March's car. Looks at our guys:
That's it. $100,000. I packed it myself... It wasn't easy putting this together on short notice. March and Healy offer no reply. She regards them oddly:
I want to thank you, for doing this. (beat) It's nice to have people like you in the world, still... What are we gonna do once we run out? Healy stands, pulls the suitcase toward him.
So, tell us where to go.

March driving. Healy in the passenger seat, eyes closed. metal SUITCASE rests on the backseat. March drives in silence. Smoking... But then, after a few moments, his eyelids start to droop. He shakes it off.
Man, I'm getting kinda tired here... (glances over) Healy? Healy SNORES lightly.
Terrific...  93 He stares back out the windshield. Concentrates on drivin But his eyelids grow heavy again. His eyes shut for a sec He snaps them back open:
Shit. Hey, Healy? Wake up! Healy mumbles something. Looks over:
Sorry, I'm falling asleep here, man. You're gonna have to drive.
Alright. Pull over at the next turn off.
Okay, cool... (beat) Listen, you worried at all -- I mean about making this drop?
Not me... I got insurance-- He pulls up his pants leg revealing an S&W AIRWEIGHT REVO in an ankle holster.
This baby right here... Never leaves me. Ever.
Cute... Let's just hope you don't have to use it. (noticing) I'll pull off here.
You know what? You don't need to pull off... The car can drive itself.
(confused) What are you talking about..?

Just let go of the wheel, man. March considers for a second... Then tentatively lets go of the wheel--  94 And sure enough, as they approach a bend in the road, the car turns all by itself... March looks delighted:
Hey, I didn't know it could do that!

You kidding? All cars can drive themselves. It's amazing what Detroit can do these days. From the back seat, a GIANT, MONSTROUS KILLER BEE, roughl feet tall, LEANS FORWARD. Turns it's humongous COMPOUND E towards March. Oversized tongue protruding, says:
Yeah, March, where the fuck have you been?
Like you know! You don't even drive, you fly everywhere, asshole.
He's got a point there, Bumble... You can't even WHAT THE FUCK ARE YOU DOING?!
He fell asleep at the wheel. He's been dreaming. Healy is YELLING at him:

March whips his head around-- They're headed right for a CONCRETE OVERPASS SUPPORT. HE SLAMS ON THE BRAKES. Too late -- WHAM! -- THEY SMASH INTO THE SUPPORT HEAD ON. March and Healy jolted against their seatbelts as the car to an immediate stop. The front end STOVED IN. THE METAL SUITCASE launched out of the back seat. SHATTERS the front windshield. Keeps going -- SMACK! -- IMPACTS against the concrete support. Breaking open. Showering SHREDDED NEWSPAPER everywhere. March and Healy stare out the broken windshield. In shock. Silent. Stunned.  95 The newspaper rains down all over the car. There is no money in the suitcase. It takes awhile for all this to process. March blinks:
You okay?
The suitcase.
(swallows ) I know.
There's no money.
I know. A long pause.
Maybe someone... Messed with it... I mean, uh--
Tally packed the money herself. She said so. (beat) She totally fucked us.
Yeah... (frowns ) Doesn't... make sense, I mean, why? What good's it do to... send us off on a... a thing, a--
--a wild goose chase.
Wild goose chase, exactly. Take us out of the city...
Three, four hours... When we could be back dealing with Amelia and-- March stops cold. The same exact second as Healy. Fear swims in their eyes. They exchange a look--  96

Motherf--! March keys the ignition. The engine catches -- sounds lik but at least it runs... Slams it into reverse -- PULLS FREE of the concrete support. BLASTS backwards--! Throws a smoking 180, as we CUT TO:

Holly plays solitaire. Tries to ignore the background jab of JESSICA, phone welded to her chin: JESSICA (on phone) ..-.- No, like the Waltons. Yeah, on TV. Uh-huh. Richard something. Thing on his face, yeah. What's that actor's name? THE DOORBELL RINGS. Holly gets up --
Jess, get off the phone. JESSICA (on phone) Yeah, yeah. Anyway, this new John Boy's like, a murderer. Shit, now it's gonna bug me, who was that actor..?
A BUSY SIGNAL. MARCH slams down the phone. Frenzied. Flin himself into the car, waves at HEALY, go, go --
Holly opens the FRONT DOOR. On the other side, a tall, bland-looking man with a medical bag:
You're Holly..? (extends his hand) Dr. Malek.
Hi. She's inside. Come in. He smiles amiably. Shrugs out of his coat. Shuts the door
Mind fetching your Dad?
Uh... he's running an errand.  97
Yeah? Back anytime soon?
Oh. Hour, tops.
Fine. Now, then, Nurse Holly, how's our patient? That's her? He points to JESSICA, who flashes a brisk Ally-Sheedy wav Never looks up.
No, that's Jessica. What she's got you can't fix. (points to bedroom) In there asleep. Slight fever.
On drugs, you think? What was she saying? Was she making sense? He crosses to the bedroom. Turns, and for the first time something captures Holly's attention:
Just below the right ear, looms a large, discolored LUMP. mole. Holly watches it go by... mesmerized. Frozen.
She... uh, she called us fascists. Holly, heart pounding now. And it gets worse -- an oblivi JESSICA picks this moment to chime in:

Holly. What's the name of that actor on the Waltons? Richard something. With the hockey puck on his face. Beside Holly, the man goes very STILL. The temperature in the room seems to drop. A FLICKER. He recovers quickly, like he never heard -- Too late. Holly saw. She knows. With affected casualness, she crosses to the counter:
That show's for retards. Dr. Malek, would you like a cookie? Just baked 'em.  98
None left. I looked, remember?
(quiet desperation) No, there's a couple. Doctor?
I could be persuaded. After I've had a look at Sleeping Beaut-- He stops. Turns, eyes flat and dead. Becomes quite still-

head_text.subj: HOLLY HAS A GUN IN HER HAND

text: The gun she just lifted from March's COOKIE JAR.
Nurse Holly..? Ten feet separate them. John Boy smiles. Raises his hands The MEDICAL BAG drops. A SYRINGE rolls free -- Jessica just now noticing the gun--
Holly, what are you doing?! Are you CRAZY? Holly licks dry lips, says to John Boy:
There are handcuffs in the desk, asshole. Get them. Slow. John Boy, so still it's frightening. Brow furrowed. Like he's listening to a radio only he can hear.
HEY! Did you hear me? Pause... he looks up. Consults his watch.
This is really slowing me down, Holly. JESSICA, still in shock.
HOLLY! What's going on?!
(clenched teeth) Jessica, it's him. He's the guy.  99 John Boy reaches in his pants. The action so casual Holly doesn't think to stop him. From the waistband, he produce straight-razor.
Jessica, if you help me with this, I'll only kill Holly.
March's CAR slingshots into view, past Holly's vacant LOT
March, focused. Healy stuffing an extra gun clip in his c
Come on, now... 68 and sunny...
JOHN BOY seems, if anything, MORE casual now. As he slowl walks toward Holly. A dreadful stillness about him.
Jessica. Dial 911. John Boy cocks his head. Hears a car, faint in the distan Keeps moving.
Jessica..? I wouldn't do that if I were you.
Jessica, DON'T LISTEN. The pressure, simply too much. Jessica's just a kid, she BOLTS--! Rushes headlong for the door --

head_text.subj: CROSSES BETWEEN HOLLY AND JOHN BOY

text: Mistake. A split-second advantage, and John Boy takes it. With no seeming effort, he GRABS JESSICA. SLINGS her round in front of him. Facing the GUN. HOISTS her into the air, legs kicking -- AND HURLS HER. It's bizarre. All his might, flat-out THROWS her at Holly Here she comes... Surreal. Holly DUCKS.
100 Goes CRASHING though a side WINDOW. An explosion of glass She vanishes into the night, as --
Flash through the FRONT WINDOWS of the house. John Boy se it, reacts instantly -- turns, heads for the front door--
The cavalry is here. HEALY AND MARCH burst from their CAR
Did you hear that..?
(slight head shake) Dunno... Whose car is tha-- He stops, mid-sentence. AS A STRANGE MAN casually crosses March's front lawn. In no great hurry. He spots March and Healy. Waves.
‘Evening. Healy and March, thrown. The guy, so utterly unperturbed.
Hey... Do you know what that loud noise was? The words hang in the air. JOHN BOY pauses at his car. Casually opens the trunk, reaches inside --
Yeah, just now..? I threw that girl out the window. Healy reacts instantly:

Healy TACKLES March behind a PLANTER-- As JOHN BOY comes up FIRING. A STERLING SUBMACHINE GUN. FULL AUTO. Rips the suburban nighttime to pieces. March's car takes the first fusillade. Tires blown. Glass shattered. John Boy swivels, targets the planter. Chunks concrete go flying.  101 March rolls out to one side, looks up -- SEES JESSICA. At the side of the house. Lying there.

Without thought, he powers to his feet. Sprints across tw feet of lawn. GUNFIRE chasing him. Earth shooting up in g He flings himself FLAT around the side of the house. Comb crawls to Jessica. Checks her. Alive. Gathers her up, as

Healy is making a move. First lull in the fire, he BOOKS. Across the drive. Towards March's car -- LUNGES across the front of it. Clears the hood. Touches down. Rolls. Gun aimed, UNDER THE CAR, towards John Boy's feet. SWEARS John Boy is LOOKING BACK. The killer lies flat. Already aiming under the car. Healy jumps, CLINGS to the door panel, as the world ERUPTS...
March bursts in the side door, carrying Jessica.
He half-runs, half-staggers. Rounds the corner --
Are crouched, hugging each other.
Fucking fascists!
Dad..!
Yeah, yeah, okay. Come on. He pushes them into the bedroom. Places Jessica on the be
Stay here. Don't move. He takes the GUN from Holly.  102 Runs to the FRONT of the house, and meanwhile --

Behind a eucalyptus TREE. Every few seconds he thrusts ou an arm, FIRES. Shooting blind. The TREE gets RIPPED TO SPLINTERS in response. John Boy's head snaps sideways. Sees MARCH inside the hou Doesn't miss a beat -- Draws a SECOND WEAPON from the trunk of his car. A HANDGUN. Targets March with it. While still firing at HEALY, he aims the other gun. Blows SHOT AFTER SHOT through the front WINDOW at March's scuttling form. Glass, COLLAPSING. John Boy drop-stuffs new clips so fast it's scary. Slap-click--! Slap-click--! In the midst of this, he pauses to check his watch. Frown annoyed. Off-schedule. It's taking too long --
JESSICA, now, stirring. HOLLY crouches:
Amelia, gimme a han-- (swivels round) Amelia? Reacts, startled. AMELIA, poised in the WINDOW. Overlooki the steeply pitched BACK YARD.
Tell Mr. Healy thanks for nothing.
Wait -- Amelia, NO!! Amelia JUMPS. Slips from view, plummets -- CUT TO:

He picks his moment -- BREAKS COVER. Spins into view. Puts three in the raised TRUNK LID, pow- pow-pow-! JOHN BOY, now, forced to dodge -- Healy sprints. DIVES through the shattered front WINDOW o March's house. Hits, rolls... Comes up running --  103
Back out the fucking window as he races toward cover--

Decides on retreat. Distant SIRENS, now. Approaching. He climbs behind the wheel of his car -- SHRIEKS out of the driveway. In a cloud of brick and stuc Right then, the EUCALYPTUS TREE finally BREAKS IN TWO-- Slams down with a THUNDEROUS CRACK--! Just missing his ca He screeches away. Brow slightly furrowed. Disappointed.
Crouched low, MARCH arrives at the bedroom. Opens the doo
Oh, no... HOLLY, in tears... He moves to the window, peers out: A 15-FOOT DROP, TO THE HILLSIDE. Amelia nowhere to be see

It doesn't take JOHN BOY long to realize he's riding on RIMS. Two blocks from March's, he PULLS OVER. Gets out... Approaches a random CAR. Goes to break the GLASS, stops - A POLICE CAR is approaching. The first to respond. Inbound. 30 yards out. In a split-second? John Boy changes tactics. Walks right out INTO THE ROAD. Waves his arms frantically The police cruiser SLEWS to a halt. The COP gets out, one hand on his weapon...
Sir? Please calmly tell me what th-- He's candy. John Boy MOVES. FAST. Spins the cop. Bounces his head off the hood. CUT TO:

JOHN BOY at the wheel. He hits the flashers, just for fun Checks the rear view -- Can hardly believe his LUCK:  104 Because there, running up the road, SCREAMING for him to STOP... is none other than AMELIA. He permits himself a smile. CUT TO BLACK. PAUSE. FADE IN
