POLICE CRUISERS, six of them. Flashers turning. The night wears on. Everyone's dead tired. MARCH wanders in circles. Takes an interest in the ground

Is a blanket-covered lump in the middle of the road. Pitifully small. COPS swarm round. All too late. HEALY says nothing. Looks on, his face unreadable. His client, dead. She paid him. He just stands there. There's nothing he can do. And so he just stands there.

March and Healy sit, HANDCUFFED to a bench in the hallway March stares at the ground. Healy gazes at the ceiling. They're silent. We hear the low murmur of station activity in the backgro We hold... Finally, a man enters frame. Suit, tie. Lawyer
Alright, guys. They're letting you out on your own recognizance... You'll be processed and free in an hour.
What about Kuttner? Did they question her?
(deep breath) No. They didn't... They're not going to.
Perry, listen to me--
No, March, you listen... You're lucky to be getting out at all. She's the head of the Justice Department, you can't come in here spouting this crap and expect --  105
Perry, it's true. She had her daughter killed--

March, it's your word against Kuttner's. You lose... They're gonna want to question you some more in the next couple of days -- (beat) You might want to think about changing your story. March falls silent. Healy continues to stare at the ceili
Cars backed up as far as the eye can see. It's rush hour nobody's moving. A thick CRUST OF SMOG hangs over the cit

March and Healy in the back seat. Holly up by the driver. They inch along, breathing exhaust fumes. March stares out the window. From up here on the overpass he's got a nice hazy view of the city in the morning sun.
You know those idiots -- those protester idiots? Healy looks over.
I think they were right... The birds can't breathe.
Think so?
Yeah. I think so. Silence. They inch forward some more.
Amelia dead. Misty, Shattuck. All dead. The rest of us get to choke -- (looks over) No one cares.
Well, it looks that way.  106
Guess that's how it goes sometimes.
That's how it goes a lot of the time.
Yeah... (beat) I need a drink.
The CAB pulls up outside of what's left of March's house. Glass broken. Bullet holes. Police tape. March and Holly climb out and stare at their home while Healy pays the driver.
In some ways, it's kind of an improvement, you know?

Yeah... Grab whatever you need and we'll stay in a motel or something... For tonight anyway. Holly disappears inside the house, just as a huge BOAT of car pulls up to the curb outside. Parks awkwardly. An old woman gets out. We recognize her. It's Lily Glenn, Misty's aunt. She approaches March. Looking determined ag
(last thing he needs) Mrs. Glenn, hello... I know you've been calling. I've been a little busy.
Well, I just-- (stops, seeing house) Oh, my! Your house!
Yes, my house. We're remodeling... Mrs. Glenn, perhaps now is not the time-- The old woman, sensing the brush off, ignores the house looking like a war zone. Puts her determined face back on
Now is the time, Mr. March. Have you made any progress on my case?  107
No, Mrs. Glenn. Not really... I'm not sure I'm going to. She notices Healy, seemingly for the first time.
He's supposed to be looking for my niece!
Um, yes. Heard about that.
She's alive, too. I know because I saw her. Only, nobody believes me. Why won't they believe me?
Um, I don't know, ma'am.
I saw her at her house! Right through the front window, clear as day! She was writing something at a desk. She was wearing a blue pinstriped jacket...
Sure. I've seen that jacket.
Mrs. Glenn, please... I need to get-- (stops, catching something) What'd you say?
What. .?
You've seen that jacket.
Yeah. At Shattuck's. It was in his office with a bunch of other wardrobe.
The jacket was in his office?
Yeah. A blue, pinstriped jacket. Had Misty's name on it. It was for the film.
Wardrobe. For the film.  108
I think I just said that. March blinks once. And suddenly he gets it.
Holy fucking shit!
(reacts to language) Oh, my..! Healy's totally lost now. March, suddenly excited.
Mrs. Glenn, I need you to take us to Misty's and show us exactly what you saw.
MARCH steers to a halt outside Misty Mountains' Hollywood Hills hideaway. It looks forlorn after only a week. As they all exit the car, LILY speaks excitedly:
There. That's the window. March is silent. Intent. Uses Lily's KEY, opens the door-
Spacious living room. Lot of BUILT-INS: Cabinets, console Psychedelic furnishings, erotic art. HEALY sizes it up, t states the obvious:
Mrs. Glenn. There's no desk in this room.
(flustered) Well I... I don't know what to say... MARCH, meanwhile, is looking around. Staring up at the ceiling. Examining the floor. Holly watches him:
Dad, what are you doing? March bumps the coffee table. It's pretty heavy. He kicks again. It's really heavy. Starts checking it over.

Just hang on... Hang on...  109 There's a long split down the middle of the table. He tri to get his fingers in there. Feels underneath it. Hits a latch... The coffee table splits open. We see something inside. Elevating. EMERGING. He grins -- A MOVIE PROJECTOR rises into view. LOCKS in position, click--! Pause. There it sits.
I don't understand. He turns to her, eyes twinkling.
Very simple. You did see your niece that night, Mrs. Glenn. You saw her on that wall. At a desk. In a pin-striped suit. He rummages inside the console. Healy, confused --
Wait. So what she saw... she was looking at a MOVIE?
Not a movie. THE movie. Misty's farewell performance. Projected on that wall.
You can't be serious.
You got a better idea?
All the copies of the film burned up.
Then how did Lily watch it through that window two days after it supposedly burned? Chrissakes, the WARDROBE matches. LILY stammers:
I... I'm confused -- They pay her no heed.
What if Amelia lied to us?  110
You're saying she made a copy?
A copy, yes. Wouldn't you?
And gave it to Misty.
YES. That night she came, checked the film against that wall, then carried it off with her -- all while Lily watched. Healy, wheels turning. LILY tugs March's arm:
I need to ask something --
I dunno, March. That's pretty thin... But now, against his will, HEALY's hooked. He snaps his fingers. Looks up, eyes wide:
The businessmen.
Huh?
At the Westin, remember? Bartender said she was meeting some dudes out of New York. Conducting some kinda business --
Selling them the film. (excited) See? What'd I tell you? It's out there, man. The film still EXISTS. They exchange triumphant looks. LILY, insistent now:
Please... please stop talking. They all trail off. Turn, to find her looking STRICKEN.
I listened to everything you said... Does this mean... (lip trembles) Does this mean my niece is dead..?  111 Awkward pause. Holly avoids her gaze. Healy looks pained.
She was murdered, Lily.
...I see.
But we're gonna get the people who did it.
HEALY, HOLLY AND MARCH hustle through the HOSPITAL doors. Moving fast and loose --

Okay. Remember the WHEEZING GUY, from a few pages back? T Airport Westin sequence -- his throat cut, exactly, that guy. Well, he's HERE, in bed. A survivor. Private room. Hushed, dim. He lies still. Throat bandaged He hears a sound. Looks up -- Sees HEALY enter furtively, beckon to MARCH and HOLLY. The guy goes rigid. They approach. Huffing, out of breath. Flank the bed. Mar elected spokesman. He smiles, offers pad and paper:

Hi, I don't know if you remember us, but we have a couple questions. If you can just, you know, write the answers -- The guy RECOILS. Swats away pad and pen. Scared witless. Actually makes MEWLING noises.
Whoa! Easy! No one's here to hurt you. The man seems to think otherwise. Seems INCONSOLABLE. March frowns:
Damn. What's this guy's problem? I mean, yeah, the cut throat. Obviously -- HEALY tumbles to it first. Leans in, gaze steady:
We're not with anyone else. Okay? (beat) Sir, was someone else here?  112
(catching on) Um, yeah. About six-two? Blond hair, big thing on his face? At this, the Wheezer stops struggling and promptly faints dead away. March shakes him. Again. Nothing.
Swell. Now what? March leans back against the wall to wait. Kicks somethin on the floor. Look down.
Hey... Check out the floor. There's numerous scraps of NOTEPAPER, scattered all over linoleum by the bed. Healy stoops. Grabs one. Whistles:
I'll be damned... John Boy did question him.
How can you be sure? Healy flashes the note: "DON'T KILL ME." March immediatel gets down on his knees, starts snatching up notes. Readin them. Holly follows suit.
(reading) "Please... Please..." (grimaces) That's useful. Holly's got one:
(reading) "No... We didn't get it yet..."
Didn't get what? The film? Holly just shrugs. Healy thinking:
She didn't give it them, maybe? Not yet?
They never took possession? Oh, great. That's just great. And now she's dead.  113 Healy grabs another note:
"After they were done with it..." (thinking) Hand over the film, after they're done with it. THEY. Her protest group?
The Birdy Bunch. "Done with it.." What does that mean? They scramble through more notes. Discarding one after another until March finds:
"Her friend is a projectionist." Healy stops... Frowns:
Is that... Are they talking about that protester kid, you know--
The idiot kid.... Chet! That was his name! Chet! Holly finds another note. Reads it:
"At the L.A. Auto show." MARCH and HEALY both freeze.
The Auto Show. Isn't that, like, tonight..?
Yeah... Big party. All the mucky-mucks'11 be there... The press, everyone...
You don't think--
Great place to get the message to the people, you know..? Off March's look we CUT TO:  114
Below us, a sprawling HOTEL COMPLEX. Opposite the L.A. Convention Center.

Form a "U" around a ground-level COURTYARD. Swank. Ritzy. CARS rotate on huge PEDESTALS down there. As SEARCH-LIGHT sweep the sky. There's even a dance floor on the ROOFTOP. Welcome to the L.A. Auto Show's GALA OPENING NIGHT.
We spot MARCH, HEALY and HOLLY moving among the rich and dressed. They push through the bustle of activity. Harrie of breath... MARCH corrals a passing SECURITY GUARD:
Hi there! We're looking for the projection room. The guy points up, past a giant suspended MOVIE SCREEN -- the far side of the hotel, dotted with windows.
Ninth floor. You have a pass..?
Sure. We have a pass. (the guy leaves) We don't have a pass. HOLLY, ever-helpful:

They gotta let hotel guests up, right? Before they can respond, Holly leans over, and as they pa a POOLSIDE TABLE -- she snags a set of keys from two oblivious CHATTING GUESTS. March smiles. Chip off the old block. CUT TO:

Music, heard faintly. Our guys come barreling out of the elevator. Down the HALLWAY... The whole floor's been taken over by the show. Makeshift taped to the doors. They pass a guy, March flags him:  115
Hey, you seen Chet? The projectionist?
Just left... Like ten minutes ago. Went for a drink. And you are..?
In a hurry. Thanks, buddy.

(frowns ) How'd you know my name was Buddy? They round the corner. Still moving. Scanning paper signs Healy spots one that reads "MOVIE ROOM." Nudges March. They try the door. Locked. March signals Holly, still at far end of the hallway:

Check down there... We clear? Holly looks both ways. Gives March the thumbs up. Healy grabs the handle. APPLIES HIS WEIGHT to the door pa Shifting. Heaving. An audible SNAP--! March motions for Holly to keep an eye out, as

They enter what looks like a fairly nice hotel SUITE. Cou chairs, parquet floors. And there, aimed out the WINDOW - A BIG CLUNKY PROJECTOR, rented for the occasion. THERE'S A FILM IN IT, threaded onto a PLATTER. Healy crosses the room. Plucks at the leader, unspools te feet of film. Holds it to the light --
Well. .?
(blinks, perplexed) It's... a bunch of cars. March hunkers down. Pores over the footage.
"Motor City Pride." This isn't it. It's not the film.

The projectionist, he must still have it stashed somewhere. From BEHIND them issues a calm, clear VOICE: VOICE (0.s.) My thinking, exactly. They SPIN, startled -- IT'S TALLY. In one hand, a bright, distractingly GREEN WA TALKIE. In the other, an equally distracting AUTOMATIC. She closes the HOTEL DOOR without looking, actually slams right in Holly's FACE, locks her out--
Hey, Tally, how's it going? Wow, you look great. Nice gun. She waggles the automatic:
Got it special for you. Weapons on the floor. Now. Healy sighs. Unlimbers a revolver, tosses it. Ditto March
You kill the projectionist..?
No. My associate's out looking for him now. We'll find him. Healy squints at her. Sizing her up--
Tell me, Tally. Ever killed anybody?
In Detroit, yes. Three times.
(not what he was expecting) Oh... Really?
That's where this mess began, isn't it?
Sorry?  117
Detroit. Misty Mountains was at that auto show. Last month.
(shrugs) She was stupid. Kept bragging about her new movie. The stir it would cause.
Tally, listen. You're not a murderer.
She did kill three people --

I mean, you know, deep down. Abruptly, there is a sharp KNOCKING at the door. A poorly disguised VOICE calls: HOLLY (o.s.) Room service..? Tally frowns. Her attention drawn to the door, briefly-- And that's enough time for MARCH to MAKE HIS MOVE. He drops to the FLOOR. Darts out an arm -- Grabs the CUFF OF HEALY'S PANTS. Frantic. Searching. Healy frowns down at him... Tally, too... Gun still level as March determinedly goes for Healy's OTHER leg--
What's wrong with him?
Not sure. (to March) Um... March? What the fuck are you doing? Just curious. March sits up, a trifle breathless--
Shit. I was going for the gun... I guess you musta moved it...
What gun?
The one you showed me... Your ankle gun.  118
Who told you I had an ankle gun?
You did. You showed me, remember? (floundering) You know, on the -- the road. Last night, right before we hit that, um... (frowns ) Hang on. Did I... dream that..?
Are you serious? Are you fucking serious?
No, no, wait--
You DREAMT IT, you moron. There's no ankle holster. Wow. WOW. This takes the prize--
Tally unlocks the door:
Holly..? You can come in. Holly, enters, pushing a small service tray.
Very clever, Holly.
Thanks, I thought so-- And on the word "so" Holly moves. Fast. Snatches the COFF POT off the tray and flings it at Tally... Covering her w
Only Tally doesn't seem all that bothered. Perhaps the fa the coffee isn't actually hot has something to do with it
Why did you just throw cold coffee on me?

(sheepish) I got it in the hallway... I thought it was hot. Tally just shakes her head. Moves to close the door--  AND SLIPS... Slips on the coffee puddle at her feet. She goes down with a YELP. CRACKING her head on the doork The GUN in her hand discharging, BLAM-! Takes out a lamp. And she's OUT COLD. That quick. March pops to his feet. All business.
Well, that worked out... Now, we gotta find this projectionist before John Boy.
That guy said he went for a drink... Take the upstairs bar. I'll take downstairs.

CHET, THE PROJECTIONIST, sits at the bar looking nervous. Checks his watch for the umpteenth time. Glances around. A MAN steps up a few feet away. Scans the crowd. Tall, broad, easy-going grin. Giant mole... John Boy.
Anyone here seen the projectionist? CHET gives an involuntary start. John Boy catches it. Tur
You're the projectionist..? Look, we got a problem on nine. Someone knocked over the projector. Film's all over the floor.
The film's on the floor, really?
Yeah, fuckin' mess. Follow me..? CHET nods, gulps his scotch. John Boy waits, smiling. CUT
A smaller, more exclusive version of the party downstairs MARCH AND HOLLY step out of the elevator. Survey the scen
Stay here. Guard the elevator.
Dad, I want to help--  120

Good. You can push the button for me when I get back. He walks away, leaving her fuming. Heads over to the bar. (Clearly a different bar than the one we just saw Chet at Starts scanning the crowd in vain. Absently plops down on a barstool... The second he does, hand taps him on the shoulder.
Hey, pal, what can I do for you..?
(spins his chair around) Excuse me..?
Free drinks, man. What'll you have? March blinks at the endless line of bottles behind the ba
«+. Free drinks..?
Healy makes his way through the crowds. Spots the main ba Pushes towards it... Catches the bartender's attention:
Hey, I'm looking for a guy about Five- five. Brown hair. He's supposed to be running the projector for us--
Yeah-yeah. Guy already came and got him. Something about film on the floor, right?
Which way did they go?

They took the service door, right over-- But Healy's already on the move. We follow him as he push through the service exit. He jogs down the corridor, tries the door a the far end - leads to a LOADING DOCK. Empty. He starts to head back in, when a NOISE startles h He spins. Movement, there... Inside one of the dumpsters.  121 Healy runs over -- A BLOOD-covered CHET THE PROJECTIONIST is in the dumpster Barely moving. Eyes glassy.
Jesus, Chet! Can you hear me? Chet?
Holly by the elevator, being ignored by the ultra-rich. Something catches her eye:

Clipped to someone's BELT. Looks just like the one TALLY Holly leaves her position to get a look at the OWNER... Medium height. Compact. Not young; definitely an older gu He turns -- OH, SHIT. It not an older guy -- It's the OLDER GUY. His arm in a sling. Pledge to HEALY, forgotten. Holly creeps closer to him, trying to act casual as we CU

JOHN BOY strides quickly up the stairs to the terrace lev Casually wiping something off his hands with a handkerchi Nearly collides with a party guest. A guy we recognize. F by two BURLY BODYGUARDS. It's Bergen Paulsen, the car com exec from TV. They lock eyes.
What... What're you doing here..? I can't be seen with you.
The film... It's here.
Here!? Just what are we paying you for!? You were supposed to take care of it! John Boy fixes him with a dead stare. Unnerving. Says:
I am. Then turns, keeps walking. Looking annoyed now. Reaches into his coat pocket. Takes out a Walkie-Talkie.  122
With OLDER GUY as John Boy's VOICE CRACKLES from the walk talkie on his belt: JOHN BOY (on walkie) The film's in the projector, repeat, in the projector. Older Guy snatches up his radio:
What..? We already checked--
It's spliced into the other film. Right in the middle of it... Go get it.

On my way. He clicks off. Stands, all business. Starts to go... But some sixth sense STOPS him. He frowns. Turns: Locks eyes with HOLLY. To date, they've not met. No matter. Recognition flashes between them. She heard. She KNOWS. It's in her eyes.
Don't you know it's rude to eavesdrop?
MARCH, still sitting at the bar. OLDER GUY and HOLLY step behind him... OLDER GUY leans down, says in March's ear:
I've got a gun pointed at your daughter's spine... Come with me. March turns, straightens, a big lop-sided GRIN on face. Oddly? Doesn't seem any too frightened.
A gun..? Why's that? Hey, Holly?! Your buddy here want a drink? They're FREE. Older Guy stops, surprised: This guy's plastered. Holly, somehow, looks less surprised.
Let's all just step this way, Mr. March.  123 He indicates an area behind the Port-a-Johns. Obscure. Em Screened by PALM TREES.
Hey, if you say so. It's a party, right?
Trying to help Chet. Trying to talk to him at the same ti
Chet, the film? Amelia's film? Where..? Chet's head slumps to one side, against Healy's arm. Givi him a close up view of Healy's watch... He smiles suddenl
Starts... now...
What..?
Spliced... in... Starts now... And right at that moment we CUT TO:

All is still and quiet in here. THE CAMERA slowly closes in on the projector... As without warning -- CLICK! -- the system jumps to life. The whole thing, running off a TIMER. Chet or no Chet -- it's movie time.
Suddenly all the lights dim. The search lights shut down. a blast of JAZZY, UP-TEMPO MUSIC fills the air. JOHN BOY goes rigid. Spins. Looking up--

head_text.subj: THE GIANT SCREEN STARTS TO GLOW

text: Blossoms to life as, below, A THOUSAND HEADS turn as one.
March, WOOZY. Leans on a chair back for support. Older Gu shoves HOLLY with the GUN --  124

Okay. This is far enou-- STOPS. Frowns. From below, MOVIE MUSIC. What in God's name..? He turns, distracted -- It's as good a chance as March is gonna get. MARCH'S FACE. Slack. Drunken. Miserable. And then, OUT OF NOWHERE, it transforms-- If you blinked, you missed it. Suddenly he ain't drunk. Suddenly he looks hard. And grim... And FURIOUS.
(completely sober voice)
Holly hits the floor as--

OLDER GUY doesn't react quick enough. THE CHAIR SMASHES him in the face..! And March is still in motion. Spinning -- knife-edged HAN outstretched. CHOPS viciously at the guy's NECK. Once. TW Crushes his trachea, COLLAPSES it. The man stumbles in circles. Fingers go slack. The gun drops. March is on it, instantly -- OLDER GUY grabs HOLLY. An iron grip. Gurgling..! March FIRES, BLAM--! From the ground, no hesitation. Blows Older Guy BACK... Toward the looming EDGE. He teeters, starts to go over... Still clutching Holly.

LUNGES. Sheer desperation. With his good arm, miraculousl SLAPS HOLLY BACK onto the ROOF -- Sadly, accompanies Older Guy INTO THE SKY. THEY PLUMMET. Holly SCREAMS--! DOWN. DOWN. Two men. Tumbling... Getting smaller and smaller... Until
March hits the POOL -- Older Guy, well... DOESN'T.  125 The result: March SPLASHES -- Older Guy sort of... well, POPS.

Men in tuxes, women in gowns: SPACKLED. Older Guy fucking exploded. A woman SCREAMS. BIKINI GIRLS flee the pool -- Amazingly, amid the thousand-odd folks, only a handful ev notice what happened... A RIPPLE, off to one side. JOHN BOY SEES IT. But doesn't seem all that interested. Calmly starts for the HOTEL; he's got to stop the FILM--
The doors burst open. HEALY EMERGES. Scanning the crowd. hand on the GUN in his pocket. Just in time, as, up above
"Motor City Pride," is abruptly PRE-EMPTED. Clicks. Pops. A few feet of LEADER. And then --
She looks great. Healy exhales a ragged breath. The film' rolling, the jig's up: HUNDREDS of people, gazing upward Now ANOTHER ACTOR appears on screen. We HEAR dialogue:
I'm Bergen Paulsen! I represent the Detroit auto manufacturers!
The real Bergen Paulsen watches. Thunderstruck:
Oh, my God...

Observes the switchover. He's too late. Okay, fine. Knows what he has to do. Turns, shoulders back through the crowd. Fishes in his co Approaches a poolside LAMBORGHINI, revolving on its pedes In passing, calmly rolls a HAND GRENADE underneath it. Ke walking. Produces an AUTOMATIC, never breaks stride.  126 Aiming up at the 9th floor. He targets the projector and OPENS FIRE. INSTANT PANDEMONIUM. People screaming. Scrabbling to get out of his way. He BLOWS A WHOLE CLIP skyward. No good. The film keeps right on playing...
MARCH comes to, UNDERWATER. Panicked. THRASHES wildly. God, he's DROWNING--!

head_text.subj: OPENS HIS EYES, SEES RICHARD NIXON

text: Swimming beside him. Waving... It barely registers... HE KICKS HIS LEGS-- We follow him up... up... out of the blue deep. He breaks the SURFACE. Clutches the CONCRETE. Choking, gasping -- A CAR BLOWS APART. Not twenty feet from him. The Lamborghini TEARS ITSELF TO BITS. Bystanders, killed. Ripped by shrapnel. Black oilsmoke FUNNELS SKYWARD. FULL SCALE CHAOS. A thousand people run for their lives. Our guys can kill a party like no one's business.
At roof's edge, HOLLY drops flat. Shouts down:

SMOKE billows upward. But she spots March... A tiny figure down there. On his KNEES. He waves up at he She lets out a breath. RELIEVED. Starts to turn away -- something catches her eye. THE FIL MISTY'S IMAGE starts to shake... Skips... Then, all at on THE SCREEN GOES DARK. Someone just stopped the movie.
Uh-oh.  127
Retrieving his fallen gun... He notices it too. Takes a few steps. Staring up... SOMEONE GRABS HIM. He start to recoil--! It's HEALY.

The film. Let's go. Healy pulls him toward the hotel. March, fighting to KEEP UP. Huffing, wheezing. Two sorry-ass saviors, these. Healy turns to say something -- FREEZES. Focusing past MARCH'S SHOULDER. Eyes wide. JOHN BOY. THEY LOCK EYES.
Huh? March spins, whoops, that's his THREE -- HEALY doesn't blink. Cross-draws his gun and OPENS FIRE. Through the smoke. JOHN BOY dives, rolls --

Jesus! MARCH DIVES across a sports car... Lunges over the hood. Metal, pocked..! PERFORATED. He LANDS. Shaken. Hugs the vehicle. Safe, ALIVE. HEALY, RELENTLESS. PROWLS THE SMOKE. Gun up. Around him, flame. CARNAGE.
Here's the thing: With respect to HIM? The car is stock- still. Immobile, and thus good cover. One problem:
And so is MARCH, oblivious. Behind him, scenery keeps changing... He doesn't notice. Raises his gun. Takes a steadying breath. Behind him, JOHN BOY drifts into view... March, eyes clos
Okay. You can do this. Ready? One. Tw-- BANG--! Blood LEAPS from his arm. March, SHOT.  128
WOOOOOWWW!! Fuck! Fuck! OW! He looks around. Confused. HEALY targets the muzzle flash. Lays COVER FIRE as MARCH attempts to dive back over the car, and meantime--

HOLLY comes bursting through the door: TALLY is here. Nose broken. Looks like shit. THE FILM'S o the projector, she's got it in a canister. Using electric TAPE to SEAL it. Whirls round, SCISSORS in hand --
On the COFFEE puddle from before. Goes down, SLIDING...
As Tally HURLS the scissors, THWACK--! They STICK in the wall. Holly scrambles past her... Snatches the FILM CAN.
Give me that, you fucked-up little
Advances on Holly. Murderous... With nowhere to run, Holl looks Tally right in the eye, says:

Lady, you want it..? (smiles) Go get it. With that, she turns, and rolls the can straight for the balcony RAILING. Tally FREAKS. Lunges after it -- Holly TRIPS HER. Down she goes. She SCREAMS. Leading with her face, WHACK! Into the railing. She's done. Holly then watches, mesmerized... As the future of Detroit ROLLS OFF THE EDGE. Into space.
Everyone looks up, following the sound of Tally's scream.

Arcing through the night.  129 JOHN BOY, frozen. Tracking its descent... MARCH, crouched behind a car, watching... HEALY, transfixed... CEO BERGEN PAULSEN, HIS BODYGUARDS... all RAPT. It catches the moonlight like a shiny COIN. VANISHES into the billowing SMOKE... Spell, broken:
(to bodyguards) Get me that film. And just that quickly, it's a whole new ballgame. Basically? Everyone makes a run for the film.

In a split second, everyone's up and running. March STAGGERS, nearly goes down. Beaten, bedraggled. DEA He should lie down. Instead? For no visible reason, he GALVANIZES. Suddenly he's RUNNING. HEALY appears at his side. They pour it on. Leaping obstacles. Dodging flaming wreckage -- JOHN BOY materializes. Ten yards to their right. Healy SHOUTS:
March! Get the film! Then PEELS OFF towards John Boy. FLINGS himself at the gu They go crashing through tables and furniture. Locked in combat. And meanwhile--

Up ahead, Bergen Paulsen's BODYGUARDS, sprinting for the film... March is closer. He swoops in at a dead run. Snatches up the film -- KEEPS GOING. Just clutches it to his chest and fucking RUNS. BODYGUARDS, pounding after him. He swerves, toward the HO LOBBY. Feet slapping. Breath, sawing in and out.

NowayfuckyoufuckYOUNOWAYFUCKYOU.  130 A BULLET cuts the air like an angry hornet. Hits the GLASS entryway -- COLLAPSES IT. As March LEAPS. Sails through the shattered doors... Lands. Tumbles, HARD -- rolls to his feet, KEEPS GOING.

JOHN BOY's got HEALY. He SPINS him -- SLAMS him down onto GLASS BAR. Shatters it with Healy's FACE. Healy, in trouble. SCRABBLES BEHIND HIM with both arms. Flails at John Boy's Actually jams a hand in his COAT POCKET. Yanks, tugs -- Breaks FREE. SPINS back around. Arms up -- STOPS. Noticing something. Something in his hand. It's a GRENADE PIN. He just yanked it from John Boy's pocket. He stares at it dumbly. John Boy looks, too. Oh, Shit. Healy turns and RUNS. John Boy paws at his coat. Frantic. UP. Whips it off and FLINGS IT.

A shattering ROAR. The floor tilts sideways. DEBRIS, showering. Bits of flaming wood--! JOHN BOY, ROCKED. Blown off his feet. Flung, head over heels -- HEALY, blown sideways. Rolls to his feet. ON FIRE. Hurls himself at JOHN BOY, no hesitation, and meanwhile

MARCH bursts forth into the REAR PARKING LOT. Running for his life. Running to SAVE THE FILM. Paulsen's BODYGUARDS, on his tail... Gunshot, a brittle CRACK--! Parts his hair. He jukes left. Out into the STREET and

131 Doing maybe 25 miles an hour. Not too fast, but fast enou Pops him up onto the hood. He SMACKS the windshield. LOSES THE FILM. It slips out of his hands. Starts ROLLING. Away from him. Down the street... The driver gets out, PISSED OFF:

What the fuck you think you're doing?! That's L.A. for you. MARCH, dazed, ignores him. Or maybe he doesn't even hear Struggles to his feet. Film, GONE. He dropped it. Where--? There. ROLLING. March is gonna have to CATCH it
The BODYGUARDS appear. Shove past the irate DRIVER. Knock on his ass... He starts yelling. An altercation ensues --

Breaks into an awkward, hitching jog... As, behind him, amazingly -- a FULL BLOWN FIGHT ensues. The driver SCREAM Then someone FIRES A GUN back there. BLAM--! March doesn't care. Keeps on. Like a kid chasing after a Five feet in front of him... Three feet... MORE GUNFIRE now. The driver firing at the bodyguards. Th firing back. Who knows..? March reaches out. One FINGER.. Touches the canister. STOPS it. It wobbles once. Becomes still... He snatches it up. His prize. And promptly collapses. Right in the middle of the road. Falls down. Sits clutchi the film. Looking around, addled. Woozy. Breath sawing. There are bodies over there. Flashing lights, too. People moving. The POLICE... March frowns, when did they get her He didn't notice. He's got the film. And meanwhile:
